Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle and they just keep getting better and better.The screen and resolution is so vivid and has a very fast processor, but I still wish they would make one that you could plug in either an SD or Mini SD flash card in it. But I give this Kindle a BIG 5 star. I also love doing business with Amazon, they are the best on-line company to do business with. Keep up the GREAT work AMAZON!
Reviews.Title: What a great product

Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Great device, simple to use. I love using it and so does my kid. I would give it 5 stars but the camera location is inconvenient.
Reviews.Title: Smart buy

Reviews.Author: Kerry
Reviews.Content: ... and easy to use. Love searching the web and downloading lots of games, apps, magazines, and books. Best Christmas present!
Reviews.Title: awesome....

Reviews.Author: Tim Girard
Reviews.Content: I am a PC guy. That being said it took me a little while to get used to my Kindle. But I am glad I took the time! This little guy is nifty and nifty again! I love this thing. I am not into the big fancy stuff. A little multimedia and the opportunity to work on my writing thank you and we'll all get along just fine. The Kindle Fire offers that and then some. I dig mine, dig it a lot actually. And I would recommend it to others not only for the easy interface but also for the price and durability. A cool device!
Reviews.Title: Lovin' it

Reviews.Author: vdubbgirl
Reviews.Content: this is the first tablet that i've compared to my iPad mini with retina that came as close enough to not justify all the money apple charges for it iPad.  And the price makes it the iPad killer for me.  Thanks Amazon and Kindle!  love it
Reviews.Title: ipad replacement

Reviews.Author: Traditionalist
Reviews.Content: Amazon has disclosed the fact that the blue LED attribute of the HDX 7" creates a blue/purple haze around the edges of white reading pages and white web pages. While this blue LED attribute may provide true colors for movies, games, photos, etc., it is most distracting and disturbing to readers. I have an older 32GB Fire HD, and the reading light has none of this blue/purple tinge. Before ordering this unit, I contacted customer service and was told that the problem existed only on a small number of units, and that I could replace the unit if the problem occurred. When I received the unit, the problem was very apparent, and I have decided to simply return the unit and order the newer Kindle Fire HD 7", which uses white light LED. I would have preferred to replace it with my older generation Kindle Fire HD 7", a more enhanced unit, but Amazon no longer sells that model. Since first writing this review I have received the newer Kindle Fire HD 16gb, and there is no blue haze on the unit. I do not miss the camera, microphone, and auto adjust brightness features. So, for $184 for the HD vs. $254 (with $30 deal)on the HDX, I believe I have come out ahead and ultimately purchased the model that is right for me.
Reviews.Title: Blue/Purple Haze- Very disappointing

Reviews.Author: Wildman Keith
Reviews.Content: __  Just in case you might not know it, you can download a kindle app for your PC.  I only mention this because a lot of people don't know they can read Kindle books on their laptop or desktop computer or Android or other devices. ___My favorite feature of the Kindle is the ability to get online and check on stuff such as email, facebook, Google+, various websites and even read USA Today if you want to check on the leading stories.Its size and portability give it an edge over a laptop.  So much easier and handier to carry.Its screen size give it an edge over a smart phone.  Everything is easier to see plus you can enlarge the view by dragging diagonally outwards on the screen.The reason I got the 4G LTE version is that I spend a lot of time where Wi Fi isn't available.  You need the ability to get online when you are out in the field and not at a wi-fi hotspot.-- My personal recommendation is to go with Verizon.  When it comes to 4G  I have found ATT just doesn't cut it in a lot of places. I found this out years ago when I made the mistake of getting a laptop modem that plugged into the USB outlet on the side of my computer.  I had been very happy with a Verizon 3G but thought I would upgrade to an ATT 4G.The ATT laptop modem was very slow...  almost as slow as dial up when it was out in rural areas.  It did OK hooked up to a Wi-Fi hotspot but wasn't worth much when it came to using the ATT wireless network.  Checking reviews after I bought the modem showed others had the same problem.I hope this review might help you if you have been thinking about upgrading your Kindle or getting your first one.  Good luck and enjoy it.
Reviews.Title: ... ***  So Much More than just an eBook reader....***

Reviews.Author: Ariel Acevedo
Reviews.Content: its pretty awesome. i use it for school, and for watching movies. best gift my dad has gotten me from christmas.
Reviews.Title: great gift

Reviews.Author: Glenn Knight
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife for Christmas and she loves it.  Has read multiple books on it and enjoys being able to carry it.  Good size over a full on tablet.
Reviews.Title: Good Product!

Reviews.Author: Ernest Stille
Reviews.Content: awesome product, easy and friendly  tech support i would consider purchasing another one from amazon if they were giving the deals they were before christmas.
Reviews.Title: fast shipping

Reviews.Author: Dawn Wright
Reviews.Content: In reading the reviews I was a bit worried about the blue light around the outside of the screen but I haven't noticed it and have to consciously look for it.  I did get a screen cover and a stylus as things can get pretty small and a stylus works much better than your finger to tap the correct thing.  I am very happy with the resolution and the sound.  My only wish is that I would have liked an instruction booklet as this is my first kindle as well as my first tablet.  I keep finding things that  I didn't know were there.
Reviews.Title: I love it!!!

Reviews.Author: SheilaW
Reviews.Content: Very functional for the cost & for beginners. Sharp images, ease of use and light. It also has a great functional cover. Very satisfied with this product.
Reviews.Title: Awesome little tablet.

Reviews.Author: Daniel Harmount
Reviews.Content: Had issues with the first Kindle Fire HDX 7" with the system shuting down every time I tried to connect to wifi.  Second Kindle did the same thing but also froze alot when ever I was using the wifi...I hope the third is ok.Customer service has been great and trying to fiqure out what is wrong.I believe maybe it is just my luck because I had the old kindle and loved it.
Reviews.Title: 3rd Kindle

Reviews.Author: Nancy Livrieri
Reviews.Content: Got the 3 guys in my house the best unexpected Christmas present with this item!!!! They absolutely love them! The best part for me is I got them at a fantastic price on Cyber-Monday!!!!! :)
Reviews.Title: Absolutely Best Gift this year!!!

Reviews.Author: Don L.
Reviews.Content: So fast and easy to use.I bought the Kindle to use when traveling to get e-mails.The display is crystal clear.This is my first tablet and I am very happy with it.Don
Reviews.Title: Excellent!

Reviews.Author: Steve S.
Reviews.Content: The measure of how awesome the Kindle is is I don't use my cell phone for any apps or games anymore. The cell's just for calls and texts. The display quality is truly awesome, the screen size is perfect for games and reading.  Truly, I don't know how I lived without this Kindle. A wonderful gift, too.
Reviews.Title: Totally Addicted

Reviews.Author: Loren A Stevens
Reviews.Content: I take it everywhere and use it all the time for work and play. It is perfect for my needs.
Reviews.Title: i love it!

Reviews.Author: Theresa M. Studer "Terra57"
Reviews.Content: I should no better than to question myself when looking for something major as I went and bought a name brand tablet before buying the Kindle Fire HDX and the said name brand tablet turned out to be a piece of garbarge.  Amazon has done an outstanding job with the Kindle Fire and I for one will never buy anything other than this in the future.  It works just that well.  I'm so happy now with my Kindle and it does everything all the other tablets do for a fraction of the cost.  You won't be sorry that's for sure so make sure and give this a try.  You will be very happy you did.
Reviews.Title: Wonderful!!!

Reviews.Author: OSCAR SOLANO
Reviews.Content: I'm too lazy to ever write reviews, but I just had to get a quick word out about how much I love my Kindle. I've owned every iPad and iPad mini there is, so I wasn't expecting to love the Kindle this much, or the closed Amazon Android shop.  But, in all fairness, the services and features that Amazon has implemented into their device make it a great reader and video device, I love being able to download free prime movies on the go and having my books with me. After being so long on the fence and Amazon making it harder to resist, I finally jumped. Now I can't wait to see what else Amazon has in store for us.
Reviews.Title: HAPPY, HAPPY, HAPPY

Reviews.Author: Jeremy May "Jeremy May"
Reviews.Content: I chose 5 stars because this little Kindle is awesome.  When we first received the kindle before Christmas, we wanted to load apps and books on them for the kids.  Thanks to the one push "help" button we were instantly connected to a live person that helped us obtain a critical update that was needed in order to download the apps and books.  The price of these tablets are much less than other brands and the free app selection is just as good through amazon as google play.
Reviews.Title: Works perfect, the kids love them!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I first had a Kindle Touch, then got a Kindle Fire, then I upgraded to the HDX. I love it so much because I have all my books with me at all times and it is easy to carry around.
Reviews.Title: love it

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: With an Android device, you can access the Amazon Android store, but with a Kindle Fire, you cannot access the Google Play store. It's frustrating, but nothing to keep you from buying this Kindle. I bought two - one for each daughter - and they love them. Whether they are reading, playing games, on Twitter, Facebook, etc., it's smooth, light, and the picture is crystal clear.One other thing - there is no back side camera. The only camera is on the front side (screen side), so taking video or a picture with it is difficult because you can't see the screen. Why no back camera?A back camera and access to the Google Play Store would have been enough for five stars. Without, however, four stars.Hope this helps!
Reviews.Title: Uses Android Apps, but no access to Google Play Store

Reviews.Author: JPMass
Reviews.Content: I've had the HDX for a little over a month now and I love the device. I've been an iPad user for a few years and just wanted to try something different. Since I've bought the HDX I've barely touched my iPad. I've always used tablets for more of an entertainment purpose and I feel that the HDX does that even better than the iPad. The screen on the HDX is amazing. Reading books and watching movies looks fantastic. The OS moves along with speed and I never notice a stutter. Even browsing with the HDX feels great. You can tell the Silk browser has come a long way. My only regret so far has been not getting the 8.9 inch instead of the 7 inch. Although, I may pick up the 8.9 soon anyway.If I had to knock one thing it would be what everyone else says, the limited app store. Coming from an iPad you'll definitely notice a much more limited selection BUT, it's actually not too bad. There are more apps being added constantly and so far I've found everything I've needed in the app store.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet!

Reviews.Author: K. Scanlon
Reviews.Content: The Good:It’s an awesome Kindle.  Books are easy to read, Screen clarity is great, Movies play back beautiful (if you can get them downloaded), Mayday customer support is great and worked well when I used it.  Battery life is pretty good. Thin and user friendly.The Bad:The apps that they do allow you download are not like the Android ones I am used to.  Do not expect a ton of Android type apps.  You have little or no control over the information they can access on your kindle or amazon.  It seems to me that Amazon does not value the privacy of our personal information. Some Apps even make you agree to allow them to share PERSONAL INFORMATION with other advertisers and "partners" before allowing you to install.  If you don’t agree, you cannot install.  The Facebook Application terms that are levied by amazon/Facebook are egregious, so I won’t install that app.The Special offers are not so special...Basically they hold your screen saver hostage with advertisements and movie promos.  If you want to remove them, it will cost you a fee.  (I think $15) Therefore, ads come with the Kindle.Bottom Line:  They have a great product here and they know it, I would have rated it a 5 Star if not for the BS.  It’s not like it used to be, buy our product and use it as you wish.  You must use it the way they want you to and accept their terms or don’t use it.  Imagine buying a TV and not being able to watch certain channels, having automatic ads or commercials come on when you turn the TV on and finally, in order to use the TV you have to accept the fact that they will share the information you watch with certain advertisers.  This HDX could have been a very special product, it stands on its merits and abilities, but Amazon wants to tell you how you can use it.
Reviews.Title: Not as glamorous as it was made it out to be - Several "Features" make it less valuable.

Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: It is okay, not as good as hyped.Pros:ResponsiveGreat pictureCons:FreezesCan't completely close applicationsSpeakers point backwards which is annoying since they are great, but you can't hear them and watch something at the same time.Overall:I am sending it back and getting a Windows Surface since there is more you can do with it.  I am worried that this one will freeze again, leaving me signed into all my applications so if I send it back the service tech will be able to get into my info...not really happy about this purchase.
Reviews.Title: Okay.

Reviews.Author: Hernan H Quintanar
Reviews.Content: upgraded from my kindle 6 e ink display…. HDX 7" battery sucks.  charged both of them at the same time, unplug them at the same time, didn't used them for 3 days, picked up the HDX 7" to read, and find out that I need to charge it again, my kindle 6 e ink not even 1/4 waisted.  Bad performance for Kindle Fire HDX7"
Reviews.Title: aweful battery life

Reviews.Author: peter maus
Reviews.Content: The wi-fi connection drops constantly for no apparent reason. Some days it works fine but once it starts acting up, it will continuously drop connection every 2 - 10 seconds.  My other devices have never had an issue.  If the connection issues were resolved, I would give this 5 stars.
Reviews.Title: wi-fi drops constantly

Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: Just got this product yesterday and love it so far! Had a small issue getting my books to load but used the pushbutton and got help quickly and problem resolved. This is very easy to use and figure out. I didn't even realize how much my toddler would be able to do but kindle free time might be the coolest thing ever. Now I can let him use my kindle and not worry about him getting into anything that he shouldn't be in because once in free time you need a password to exit!  Apple can't even compete with that!  What a great product. Worth every penny and cheaper than an Apple product and still has same apps. Great job Amazon!
Reviews.Title: awesome!

Reviews.Author: Johnny "JG."
Reviews.Content: I got 2 of these, one for me and one for my wife. We both enjoy them. We got the ones that have the ads on the home screen and I don't see how this could possibly bother others, once your off that page, like in 1 second, you don't see them anymore. Flash would be nice to have and I understand there are ways to install it with a new browser but I've only found one site I would have needed it on anyway. Your not going to get flash with an iPad either.
Reviews.Title: Have 2 and we love them

Reviews.Author: five times the cat
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle.I have owned the original Kindle fire,the 2012 Kindle fire HD and now the HDXHere is what I love about it:* Its super light weight.It feels much lighter than the previous versions of the Kindle fire.* The screen is super bright.Yes,my screen has the slight purplish edge.Yes,its noticeable...But I was able to get used to it. Admittedly I was initially disappointed with the purplish edge.My advice if your HDX has that issue is to use your HDX for a few days.I now only notice it if i'm looking for it.* Everything is faster on the HDX.The internet is blazing fast on the HDX.Mine holds the connection well at home and at free wifi locations.* Navigation is much improved.On previous models you sometimes had to tap multiple times to get the screen to respond. Also typing was wonky.Most of the navigation worries seem to be a thing of the past.* It's nice and loud.Here is what bothers me a little :* Charging port is horrible. It goes in on an upward angle. Does not feel or look stable.Makes me wonder WHY is it designed like that.* Battery life is less than the previous model(2012 Kindle fire HD) Does not last long on standby.* I wish the power button and the volume were NOT located on the back of the HDX. I prefered the previous button locations.* I used the Mayday button to ask a question about printing from my HDX.Specifically I wanted to know where on the HDX could I  access the print screen amazon shows a shot of in the product tour video. Well my advisor answered fast but when I asked my question she kind of rolled her eyes and made an exasperated sigh. She then said hold on.Her screen went from a live shot of her to a graphic of a pair of headphones.Then another voice started talking to me. It turns out the Mayday advisor transferred me to a amazon phone support rep.I had to repeat my question and she then said she would email some info about how to print from a Kindle.Overall, I think its a great tablet.If you're thinking of  upgrading your 2012 Kindle fire HD.I say go for It. There are plenty of improvements to enjoy.
Reviews.Title: I love it!

Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I love it!I purchased it the end of Oct 2013, still having fun easy learning even for a beginner. Have used the "0n line helpline. Great experience. Yes will still have some kinks to work out but due to me more in comprehending new technologies.I am 71 years old so first time with the tablet.I have cataracts that are not ripe yet so love the fact that I can brighten the lighting and fonts.
Reviews.Title: kindle fire HDX 7"

Reviews.Author: Tiggy Moore
Reviews.Content: This is actually the second Kindle HDX 7" that I have had. The first, which I ordered before Christmas 2013 (a 16 GB machine, wi-fi only), had to be returned because of the blue halo-ing screen issue. Although I liked it, I already knew that if I tried the Kindle again, it would also have to have a larger storage capacity. So when Radio Shack had Kindles marked down for New Year's, I bit the bullet and grabbed a 32 gig. I am happy to report that the new machine does not have the screen issue and seems to work fine.My impressions of this tablet are that it is the perfect companion to tote around in lieu of its larger far removed cousin, the iPad. (True, the iPad Mini is just as good for a 7" tablet.) Although one is a modified version of Android, and the other is iOS, they pretty much do the same thing, which is give the user the ability to consume media, albeit on different levels. It is true that Apple does have a larger app selection, and that some Google apps are totally shut out of the Amazon ecosystem--but I haven't found that to be a problem because the basic apps I want to access: News, Netflix, internet and a few others are available on both platforms. I also have no problem issue with the fact that the device only has a front facing camera. I don't Skype or use a tablet camera anyway, so it's a moot point. Both my phone and iPod 5th gen have cameras that work just fine when I want to snap a pix. People who complain about the lack really should research before they purchase an item. There are multiple review platforms on YouTube that show the actual device in real-world situations. Lack of knowledge is not an excuse when you have access to the internet.As for how the Kindle HDX functions, I will give it a thumbs up. The display is crystal clear, the sound is decent and the ability to access the content I want works just fine. It is true the tablet is linked directly to Amazon, but this isn't a problem. I am not a Prime member, but may go ahead and join later on. I also don't mind the screen saver-come-advertising, which often offers great deals in books I am interested in. It's not as annoying as I thought it would be, and I can always pay the 20 dollars later on if I decide I want ads removed.Overall, this is a nice little tablet to tote around, and covers everything you want at hand if you're confined to a situation where you want the basics without carrying around a laptop or larger iPad. Put on a nice case, throw it in a bag and go. You've got books, movies, email and internet on hand. Perfect in every way.One more thing I might mention. Yes, it is compatible with iTunes without having to purchase conversion software, and you can transfer your entire library to the Kindle with a few clicks. Sure, it takes a simple workaround, but the music transfers fine, even if you've purchased most your music through Apple, as I have.A+ to Amazon for creating an affordable, fun little tablet. And solid 10 to customer service, which is always a pleasure to deal with.
Reviews.Title: A second look at the Kindle HDX 7", 32 GB

Reviews.Author: jimstur
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kindle for my son and I couldn't be more pleased. Very fast and functional. My son is a very recriminating technology user and for him to give it the thumbs up means everything.
Reviews.Title: awsome

Reviews.Author: Deb in Spokane
Reviews.Content: I'm absolutely surprised and delighted with this purchase. This is my first electronics update since a laptop in 2007...I've missed a lot but this Kindle made it incredibly easy to catch up. Even my 80-year-old Dad who refused to look at a computer is using this! The Special Offers are not intrusive. Start up is a snap. I bought a keyboard case but this is absolutely unnecessary as the tablet keyboard is extremely easy to use. I love the small size for ease of transport. I compared it to an 8" iPad 3 and size and content of the iPad 3 is not worth the additional hundreds of dollars. Thrilled with this update of my electronic life and am looking forward to maintaining my Amazon Prime membership. So far, this has been an exceptional purchase!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7", HDX Display, Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers

Reviews.Author: J. Harbour
Reviews.Content: About fifteen years ago I had a Dell Inspiron that caught on fire and melted. Yes, I was one of those with the bad battery. I received such poor customer service that I went out and replaced the Dell with the Apple PowerBook, their main competitor at the time. And, I never looked back. I have been a part of the Apple ecosystem for more than a decade now, and couldn’t be happier. The design, the experience, the quality. Yes, I know, I’m trapped in their rigid world and the man is holding me down.When they came out with the iPad the public said, huh? We don’t need this, and then gobbled them up by the millions, because Apple had figured out what we were about to. People don’t like to relax with laptops. Open that thing up and you feel the need to do something. It’s because of the keyboard. It’s an input device that is waiting, begging, for your attention. But a tablet is pure consumption. No work required. Just sit back, read a book, play a game, watch a movie. They adopted the Gillette model of business: They didn’t sell the razor handles to make money, they sold the razor handles to sell you blades. The blades here are the apps. And Apple made millions off of the apps. Then came the followers with cheap, poorly made tablets to try and compete and each got smacked down in the process.So here I am with a first generation iPad, yes you read that right — first gen, and I’m looking to upgrade. I’m thinking the new iPad mini because I want a smaller form factor for flights. It’s before Christmas and I’m in BJ’s. The Christmas lights are blinking and everything is warm and bright. I spy an Amazon Kindle Fire on sale for $99. That’s interesting I think and I move along with the tasks at hand. The thought sticks in my mind and I start investigating the Kindle line. I’m already in deep into the Amazon system; Being a writer my wares are mostly sold there, I need to follow Goodreads daily, and for movies I’m already a Prime member. I take a hard look at how I use the iPad. Email, check. Browse the web, check. Watch some movies, check. But mostly I use it to read books and magazines through the Kindle app. I abandoned  iBooks  years ago. I should support my biggest professional partner, I think, and then start really looking at the Kindle line. Amazon, too, follows the Gillette model. They are selling the HDX almost at cost so that it is easier to buy books, apps, and anything else that Amazon sells.So I dig. I read. I go to Best Buy to showroom the models. And I’m surprised. They’re good. They’re damn good. And they are half the price of the iPad with the same specs (64GB). I make a decision I didn’t think I would two years ago when the first one came out…I placed my order with Santa for a Kindle Fire HDX and waited for Christmas.Fast forward to now. Of course I got the Kindle as Santa is a close friend of mine and I have been giving it a stress test probably only seen in the Amazon Lab. Along with the Nexus 7 (Not Microsoft. Microsoft still doesn’t get it, they want to make you work on the damn things.) there is a serious threat to Apple’s market share. It is a beautiful piece of kit. Sleek and light with a rubberized back that makes it easy to hold while reading. The Kindle Fire is my new best friend. It took me a day or two to get used to where the buttons were but now I can’t imagine them in a different place. The performance is amazing. HD games feel like they are on a console and reading on it is a joy. I know there are some complaints about the blue hue around the edges of the screen. It’s there, but I’m okay with it. Those that keep returning theirs because of the hue are, in my opinion, a bit of the Princess and the Pea. Myself, I’m impressed and ecstatic about the device, and can’t say enough about it. If I find something, I’ll post it here but don’t hold your breath.Will I give up my MacBook Air? Not a chance in hell. iPhone? Possibly. iPad? Yes. Kindle Fire HDX? You make the call.
Reviews.Title: Come on in, the water's fine.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. Armstrong "Jeff Armstrong"
Reviews.Content: Great for everything I need and my only complaint is I have a hard time pulling away from it...  Also it's much too easy now to order more stuff from Amazon.  Believe this is a plot by Amazon.  You guys are brilliant. Great tablet.
Reviews.Title: Great reading tool and tablet

Reviews.Author: MIKE G.
Reviews.Content: I have had three kindles and I enjoy each and every one of them! The HDX is by far the sharpest and simplest to use to date. I am in my mid fifties and some times fumble on electric gadgets and getting frustrated at working with things that others seem to have no problems with. I find the Kindles to be very user friendly and I have yet to use the help feature to navigate or search for secrets that I think some designers fit in just to aggravate some of us?...Kidding! I have had no real difficult times down loading or up loading video or books, music and what not. I realy like using this as I find myself late for appointments because I get lost in just playing.Buy it play with it and you too can miss appointments  and lose track of time.
Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX 7" 16 GB

Reviews.Author: M Sullivan
Reviews.Content: I just got the kindle fire HDX 6 days ago and I love it. I have no problems with it. This is my favorite kindle. If you are looking for a kindle fire. I highly suggest getting this kindle fire HDX 7 in or the kindle fire HDX 8.9in.
Reviews.Title: amazing, my favorite kindle fire ever.

Reviews.Author: Sherrie Kwiatkowski
Reviews.Content: This is such a FANTASTIC product!!  Compact, easy to use and has everything at your fingertips!!  This product has made my traveling life so much simpler...everything is in one small, easy to use package that fits in my purse and doesn't have to be "placed in a separate bin for security reasons".  Makes airport travel a snap!!!
Reviews.Title: Fantastic!

Reviews.Author: Dale Beckes
Reviews.Content: This being my first tablet, I was drawn to it by the reviews, especially concerning the display.  Gorgeous.  I like the feel of it and its speed.  But, there are a couple of drawbacks that might have made me make a different choice if I had researched it better.  The biggest drawback is the lack of support for the Google Play Store - I know Amazon is trying, but at least 50% of the apps that I want, are not available on the Amazon Store.  I hope that percentage improves soon.  The other disturbing drawback is the lack of support for Flash Player.  I know that Amazon is working on a replacement player (I have had chances to try their Beta...and it's just OK), but why not just support Flash?
Reviews.Title: Great tablet, with a couple of caveats

Reviews.Author: B. Anderson
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle Fire. I purchased the first generation when the first week it was available, kindle Fire HD a year after it was released and the Kindle Fire HDX 7" on Black Friday.Loved the first gen Kindle except for it's horrible Silk browser.Returned my Kindle Fire HD because it kept disconnecting when I played games on it.It's been two months since I purchased the Kindle HDX and there isn't anything I don't like about it. The picture and sound quality are better than my first generation Apple Mini Pad. The Silk browser preforms exactly how I expect a top-of-the-line browser to whether it's on a pad, laptop or desktop computer.I highly recommend the Kindle HDX 7"
Reviews.Title: Best Pad I own atm.

Reviews.Author: Michael A. Penzo
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire, it can do everything an iPad can do and more.  I highly recommend it.
Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire 7" HDX

Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I purchase the new Kindle Fire HDX 7" as a Christmas present for my wife because she is an avoid reader and I wanted her to have the ability to purchase books without constantly going to a book store or waiting for a book to be delivered through the mail.  Although she isn't much of a new tech enthusiast, she absolutely loves her new Kindle and has been amazed at how easy it is to use.  She also used the new 24/7 on-line Mayday service several times when she first started using it and the service personnel were very courteous, professional and answered all of her questions. I also purchased Kindles for my Daughter and Granddaughter and they are equally thrilled with them. I highly recommend a Kindle HD for anyone who's primary interest is reading and the Kindle HDX for those that want all of the other new features it offers.
Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX is the Way to Go

Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I was just looking for a Kindle to replace my old whitepaper version - one I didn't need to turn the lights on to read.  What I got was a multimedia power house in a 7" package, that lets me (1) watch HD movies with great Dolby sound, that I can also send to my TV, (2) keep track of both my personal and work email, (3) link to my company's ERP system to actually work remotely, (4) keep up with all my social media sites, (5) play some really entertaining games, (6) learn to speak a new language (Duolingo app), (7) listen to my music collection both on the device and in the cloud with great stereo sound (that seems to come from a space beyond the Kindle)... oh yeah, and my e-books look better too!  I could keep going with more things it can do, but the bottom line is that it's faster, with better sound and graphics, than my smartphone, and more entertaining than my PC, and it fits in my pants pocket.
Reviews.Title: Totally Blown Away

Reviews.Author: Marie Alexander "start2finish"
Reviews.Content: I am used to Apple, but I am finding the Kindle to be very user friendly and I love the Tech support.
Reviews.Title: Learning curve

Reviews.Author: Lisa F. Wilson "I enjoy listening to audible ...
Reviews.Content: I had an original kindle Fire, and just upgraded to this version. What a difference! This one is snappy, looks great, and has a very nice touch sensitivity, something I always struggled with previously. Great interface with Amazon, apps, web, and a terrific price!
Reviews.Title: Nice!

Reviews.Author: Chili POP "the improv frog"
Reviews.Content: As I have 3 ipods, 1 imac, 1 macair....I am a huge  fan of Apple products, but I am glad to say I purchased the Kindle Fire HDX 7' instead of the iPad mini.  way more cost effective, and quite honestly, in my opinion it is a better product for me. I use mine primarily for downloading and reading books, as well as watching movies on Amazon Prime and Netflix.
Reviews.Title: love it. So glad I got it.

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: If I had to describe the kindle HDX in a single word it would be AWESOME!! It's fast, the screen is amazing and love watching movies from my prime account. What a way to start the New Year. Thanks Amazon!!
Reviews.Title: Awesome

Reviews.Author: Mary "Nurse working at being a nurse practiti...
Reviews.Content: We bought it as a gift. The only thing the recipient did not like was the camera is not reversible. It really should be mounted to point at someone rather than forward.
Reviews.Title: camera only faces forward

Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Great I Recommend this to anyone I love it I should have got 32 gb tho but 16 is enough
Reviews.Title: kindle

Reviews.Author: midi73
Reviews.Content: Love my kindle fire HDX 7". The special offers (ads) don't bother me, not worth the money to not have them in my option, but what does bother me is the 16GB.  It has already filled up fast and I barely got it. Also, the lack of support for the Google Play store is a major issue for some of us. I like the Amazon app store but until it has a lot more apps or access to the Google play store, this will be a deterrent to purchasing another Kindle for me.
Reviews.Title: Great product

Reviews.Author: Tony DeLisio
Reviews.Content: I owned the the first Kindle Fire and enjoyed it alot.  Still have it and its working great.  I got some got a little money for my birthday and Christmas and wanted to upgrade.  The HDX had everything I was looking for..  When I received it I could not believe the improvements.  The sound quality is great.  I was working on it all night setting up my email, contacts and calendar.  Lets say I used up all my money to get this and it was worth every cent.  I looked at the Google but all the others look like a big phone.  I wanted something with a different look and feel.  I give it two thumbs up!
Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX 7 Second Gen.

Reviews.Author: Taryn Gahagan
Reviews.Content: Needs to come with some kind of instructions, not just young people who enjoy reading from such devices. A lot of younger kids use such devices more than older, but being a little older it's sometimes harder to just pick it up. I know I can use mayday and will do so I'm sure more than the younger kids.
Reviews.Title: instructions

Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: Order came quickly and on time (Christmas Eve).  It takes a little getting use to. Quit different from the iPad(more user friendly) however, the quad core makes loading extremely fast. Downloading app takes about 15-20 seconds. Very nice.  The clarity of the front cam (no rear cam) is actually better than the iPad's cameras. Haven't watched any videos yet. So far the functions I've used are good. I am satisfied for the price.
Reviews.Title: So far so good

Reviews.Author: Breezer815
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire. The size and weight are great. Not too big, but have a good screen resolution for watching videos/playing games. Sounds is great. Easy to get around. The only downfall is that sometimes it has a lag time with swyping and scrolling even after having it only a month or so. Overall, though, well worth the price.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet

Reviews.Author: Kristen E. Bogren "Kristen Bogren"
Reviews.Content: I love my new HDX Display Kindle- I wavered back and forth actually needing a new one as my HD Kindle I bought last year worked great but I loved the new Operating System, and everything seems to work better, and more smooth. The sound is awesome, way better then my first HD Kindle- Sound is stereo like, and perfect for me. Battery life is better, just a all around better product.I gave my mom my older Kindle fire and we Skype on in, the video chat still works awesome. I am very happy with my decision to buy the upgraded kindle- It moves faster, things run more flawlessly- Happy with my decision !
Reviews.Title: Faster more Flawless Kindle

Reviews.Author: SP "Slim"
Reviews.Content: This is the best gadget that I have ever purchased. The screen is so clear and the sound is awesome. I love it. I bought my wife the 8.9 HDX and the video 1080p is nuts. We have a baby girl and the 64 gig is alot of storage for memories! Thanks Amazon!
Reviews.Title: Wonderful

Reviews.Author: Mary C. Mcgrath "her-is-murr"
Reviews.Content: was purchased for my son who is in the military and must live out of a duffel bag.  this was small, lightweight and hands down the best gift for him.
Reviews.Title: excellent!

Reviews.Author: H. C. Keith
Reviews.Content: I already have an iPad, which I love, but my husband is always using it.  I love to read too, so I thought for awhile about the Kindle.  Bought it for myself for Christmas, and am so glad I did!!!  Clear, sharp display, quick response, and i love to tap into my Amazon Prime account to borrow books for FREE!  I can prop this up on my recumbant bike and read or watch a show while getting my exercise (benefit - I exercise longer!).  Small enough to easily drop into my purse.  I think this may become a normal part of me like my phone!
Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Author: Tracy Dorey
Reviews.Content: I just got mine delivered today around noon and haven't put it down since. Yo everyone who is saying that they aren't getting what they were expecting then they were obviously expecting the impossible or an iPad. This is not an iPad, the is an e-reader/tablet. No the selection of games isn't as dense as on an iPad or android devise but the media selection is phenomenal. I've done everything on this devise from reading books/magazines to playing games and surfing the web to downloading music and videos. The speed of this quad-core processor is unreal, faster than my core i3 laptop. This thing is absolutely wonderful and am completely satisfied with my purchase. I would honestly pay upwards of 300 for a device of this nature. Money well spent and would recommend to anyone looking for an awesome tablet.
Reviews.Title: simply amazing

Reviews.Author: Darline Mason
Reviews.Content: An old grandma learning new technology! I am learning to use this product and really am enjoying it. It has been nice to have so many items on one product to use whenever I want. Highly recommend. A++
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7"

Reviews.Author: Sahar
Reviews.Content: I was considering the mini iPad but since I was just looking for a media device, chose the Kindle Fire.  I got it and immediately was impressed with the display.  WOW!  I brought it into work and a colleague brought her first generation mini iPad.  There was no comparison.  I can't speak for the new Retina mini iPad but I've been told the Kindle Fire HDX still looks better.The top reasons for purchasing the Kindle HDX was to read books, get news, send email, text from Google account (which it does), watch short movies (90 minutes or less by streaming or from my Cloud), and listen to my music (all in Cloud).In addition, I've turned my Kindle Fire HDX into my alarm clock/sleep timer to ocean waves, my event calender, sole source for Skyping, and main internet searching device. (I don't play games)I have a Macbook but since I've bought the Kindle HDX, I really haven't used my Mac much.I did buy the 16GB and that gave me just under 11 GB when I got it.  After downloading the apps I needed and a song, I still have close to 10 GB.  I basically use the Cloud for everything.I really don't have anything to complain about.  It is doing everything I need.
Reviews.Title: All I ever needed and more

Reviews.Author: Bellesmom "bellesmom"
Reviews.Content: I have not had it for very long but so far I am happy with it.  It is a bit harder to navigate than my KF 1st gen 7" but some of the new features are really nice.  My favorite so far is the way I can tap on the books in my library & it gives me the info on the book as if I picked up a paperback & read the back times 10 , meaning you get all the info pertaining to that particular book.  That is a really great help when you are selecting your new book , especially when it has been a while since you purchased it.
Reviews.Title: I love the new features, it makes my library much more user friendly.

Reviews.Author: Cdawg & Co.
Reviews.Content: Incredible product. Chose this over other similar tablets based on good reviews, screen resolution, price and reliability of the android operating system. Side by side comparison of this versus previous HD model showed the vast improvement in picture quality and resolution. Price is unbeatable for what device offers. Amazon literally sells these for less than their production costs. They take a loss on each one sold! That's a company and product willing to take a risk for the benefit of the customer and the hope they will use this great device to buy other products.Highly recommended
Reviews.Title: Amazon takes gamble but everyone wins!

Reviews.Author: Todd Aldrich
Reviews.Content: I was looking at many different tablet options.  I decided on the kindle fire hdx 7".  I couldn't be more happy with it.  It does exactly what I need it to do.  For the cost compared to other tablets and the quality I believe this is the best choice for a handheld tablet.  The negative reviews I saw about a bluish hue along the edges are extremely dramatized.  While I have noticed the bluish hue around the display it is not very noticeable even when reading against a white background.  Unless I was actually looking for it I didn't even notice it was there.
Reviews.Title: My first kindle and I love it

Reviews.Author: james barksdale
Reviews.Content: I really like this product. I would give the product 5 stars if it wasn't for the "Special offers". The special offers are advertisements that are displayed on the Kindle after power up or sleep mode. You either pay not to get the special offers or pay to remove them later. It cost $15 to remove...
Reviews.Title: Great product

Reviews.Author: justin
Reviews.Content: Overall the tablet is very functional, aesthetically pleasing, long-lasting in the power department, and provides amazing resolution.  Everything about this tablet is great and for the best price on the market when considering top name tablets.  Two negatives drop this down to a four star.  The ports being at an angle cause problems when using more protective cases.  App selection is dismal.  This is ranked as a top student tablet and I can't get blackboard without using the actual website.  Missing many big name apps and all the hidden gems.  This must change.
Reviews.Title: great tablet, just needs some apps

Reviews.Author: I. Fagin "Lewyland"
Reviews.Content: Yes, I'm in love with my new kindle fire. A bit of a learning curve cause I'm usually an apple person. But the mayday feature is great.
Reviews.Title: What's not to love?

Reviews.Author: Jennifer Kidwell
Reviews.Content: Gave it as a gift. Was perfect. I was also very pleased that I received this in just 3 days.
Reviews.Title: Great item

Reviews.Author: amy
Reviews.Content: I love having this Kendal hd I love how you can talk to a person when you have a problem and they can walk your problem. My husband loves it also I get to use while he is at work and he plays games all night. I love the kindle I like it better than my own computer.
Reviews.Title: Very nice product I would buy another on later on.

Reviews.Author: cherishak
Reviews.Content: This is a great product but it still has its glitches. The first two weeks were great then the download queue started acting up. They fixed it but now my kindle will turn on the talk button every once in awhile and it tells you everything you touch. It is easy to turn off though. I can't tell you enough about the help team they are fast and you have a button to help you walk through any problems that you have. I connected with a tech that could see my screen and he walked me through everything. I would buy this again.
Reviews.Title: Really good help from the service people

Reviews.Author: lexie Sherwood
Reviews.Content: loving the kindle fire hdx, the only reason why i didnt 5 star is theres no way to customize the "wallpaper".
Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx

Reviews.Author: babygirldmc
Reviews.Content: Loving my new Kindle Fire right now. Loved the 1st generation Fire as well but this one is faster and the screen is clearer due to the HD. I like the fact that I can print to my wireless printer and the keyboard has the letter trace capability. Also I pulled the pics off my phone thru cloud so I could see them on here. The only thing so far that I don't like is that there is no way (or I haven't figured out how) to select multiple emails so I can delete them unlike my other Kindle Fire. Besides that....Awesome!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7"

Reviews.Author: ROB SMURAWA
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!  Affordable for such advanced technology.  Speed, weight, resolution, battery life all major pluses.  Think Apple needs a new horse to win this race.  My opinion...
Reviews.Title: A winner, as they planned...well

Reviews.Author: h. Richard  greatest game ever.v
Reviews.Content: This is the best Kindle yet!  Greta memory, fast connections, and all-around great choice in a tablet.  I'm glad I chose it!  The only drawback is that the "slide" open button occassionally sticks" and I have trouble opening the device  - Other than that, it's still my favorite!
Reviews.Title: Best Kindle ever!

Reviews.Author: L. Meeks
Reviews.Content: Great upgrade to kindle fire.  I had some battery issues with the one I bought so I went to amazon customer service.  They replaced the kindle two times and gave me a return label at no charge for the bad ones.  Great tablet, great customer service!
Reviews.Title: great tablet, excellent customer service to help with battery issues

Reviews.Author: Molly Rigg
Reviews.Content: I have had my kindle fire hex 7" for a month now and absolutely love it.  The sound and picture is wonderful.  The special offers are pretty cool that you can get.  My kindle is very easy to use. Overall this is an awesome product.
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: bcb
Reviews.Content: Kindle has done it again.  The Kindle Fire HDX is much better than the Kindle Fire and makes me wonder how I ever got along with just the plain old first Kindle, which I loved at the time.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX Is Much Better Than Kindle Fire, which Was Already Great!

Reviews.Author: Suzanne Pepple "duzy suzy"
Reviews.Content: I have nooks and also the kindle paper white - but this e reader is the best yet!  it does it all and has beautiful picture.  I would highly recommend - You will not be disappointed.
Reviews.Title: Great Product

Reviews.Author: scottkwimer
Reviews.Content: Fast,simple,music sounds amazing. Printing and creating documents and pdf files is a real plus. Smooth operating. Love it. Oh...can read books too!
Reviews.Title: office elements and printing are a welcome and needed perk.

Reviews.Author: Ashagail
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the quality and the functionality of such a small device. I built my computer by hand about a year ago spending almost a grand in parts and my kindle surpasses it in every way. The video is spectacular, sound is so great that it pulsates through the small speakers on the back and the WiFi is much more reliable than my android.
Reviews.Title: Most satisfying purchase to date. I'm addicted.

Reviews.Author: DMEDelivered
Reviews.Content: So far I really enjoy the tablet.  It's battery life is not as long as I had hoped, but it is still adequate.  The advertisements option is not bad at all, I've actually accepted a few of the offers.  As Christmas rolls around there are a lot of tablets on sale.  That said, I'm still leaning towards the Kindle being worth a bit more as it does seamlessly connect with amazon while also functioning well as an adroid tablet.  Also, Reading kindle docs on here is much better than I expected. The reading mode or screen just makes it pop.  I thought I would have to get a paperwhite if I really wanted a reader, but this more than meets my expectations.  I would definitely look at another or suggest it to a friend who wants a tablet that does exactly what it says it does.  Also, the camera specs don't do it justice.  The pictures are turning out better than you would think based on the spec.  The more I write this, the more I realize it has exceeded my expectations and maybe I should have given it a 5!
Reviews.Title: Great tablet, might not be the cheapest out there, but worth the price.

Reviews.Author: Leamm
Reviews.Content: For the most part I am totally thrilled with the new Kindle HDX. I love watching videos and reading books. I would give it 5 stars except that I have had it "restart" all on its own while reading. Very odd, no idea why. Not a big deal as it "boots" right back up on its own and I'm right where I was before it shut down. Hope this happens only occassionally, but so far three times since I got it.
Reviews.Title: Except for a "restart" problem - It's great!

Reviews.Author: J. Paisley
Reviews.Content: I ended up buying a second one because my wife and I enjoyed it so much.  I really had to go looking for the "blue screen" edge I have seen complained about and it is absolutely a non-issue for me and completely un-noticed when I am using the device.it is solid technology at a great price.  Use it for reading, photo showing, netflix, pandora, email, games, amazon videos, accessing my sky drive office documents with an app ect.
Reviews.Title: Love the thing!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Kindle Fire, Paperwhite, Keyboard, Fire HD and now 2 different HDX's.  The 2 HDX's are the only Kindle products I've ever had to return. This has the potential to be a great tablet once the bugs are worked out.  The bugs consist mainly of dropped wifi connections, the tablet showing a pop up message that you're not connected to a network when the notification icon shows fully connected, and completely "forgetting" wifi networks on a regular (almost daily) basis.  The first one was "buggy" out of the box, and I had to do 2 factory resets before it would even connect to a wifi network and allow me to register.  I tried factory resets numerous times on the first one and finally returned it.  I then purchased another one and it functioned out of the box, but the wifi issues started within 24 hours.  I did a couple of factory resets and the issues persisted along with random restarts.  After researching the issue online, it appears to be common.  I contacted customer service...who are always fantastic simply to ask if they planned a software or hardware "fix" for these issues.  They offered to exchange the tablet.  In my experience, Amazon is always very quick to fix any software issues...but not so much for hardware.  The solution always appears to be to stand behind the hardware and exchange it if justified.  I've had fantastic experiences with their customer service department.  But then again we buy the majority of our groceries, toiletries, household items and gifts from them...so it's obvious we're very loyal customers.  But in this case after having the same issue with 2 units purchased 3 weeks apart, I opted to simply return the HDX and wait for future "fixes" or for my HD to break beyond repair.  My Fire HD still works great, and I don't need to spend $250 on a table with "OK" improvements that is buggy,  I read and watch movies.  The screen on the HDX is bettter than the HD, but the speakers aren't quite as good.  It's certainly lighter and detaches from the cover easier, but the Origami cover isn't true to the original.  The original "origami" cover would allow you to position the Fire in at least 3 positions including a slanted keyboard setting...the new one only does vertical and horizontal.  We use the video out on the Kindle HD a lot while travelling so the kids can watch "safe" shows in hotels rather than risking the exposure to ^%&$ on hotel cable.  The HDX can employ a wireless device, but it has no mini HDMI out like the HD.  While the volume buttons on the HD were poorly positioned, at least you could reach them while holding the unit in it's case.  When using the Origami case with the HDX the buttons are covered.  So the HDX is faster, lighter, smaller, better screen, better UI, worse speakers, worse connectivity and buggy.  The HD is slightly heavier and larger, fantastic screen but not as good as the HDX.  But it's a 7" screen...I'm still trying to figure out why anyone needs that high of resolution on a 7" screen...but people want it on a 4.7" phone so...  The HD has better speakers and connectivity.  For those interested, the HD can also be "rooted" without losing the Kindle UI or access to Prime instant video features.  As of the time of this review, "rooting" HDX has presented issues for those that don't REALLY know what their doing.  Of course I would never recommend doing this either way since it voids the warranty, but at least there are ways to get that other "store" on the HD without losing all the great Amazon features.  I would have liked the 8.9 tablet, but I think it is way too expensive when you can pick up a Nook HD+ for about 1/3 of the price.  It has the "other" lay store and is easily adapted via the SD card slot to access the Amazon app store.  Of course there's a reason it's priced that low...talk about a "fire" sale!  :)
Reviews.Title: Eventually this will be a great tablet!

Reviews.Author: Sarah Nickels
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 Kindle Fire HDX's as Christmas gifts for my 11yr old and 9yr old. One works great but the other had issues from the start. Kept randomly powering off (among other things)! And now it won't turn on even after troubleshooting. Very Frustrating when you've had it for less than 2 weeks. Spoke to an Amazon Customer Care Rep and they said it's a software issue. Said that they'll send out a new one. Overall we liked the Kindle Fire (when it worked) and Amazon did do a good job at resolving my issue promptly with little hassle.
Reviews.Title: Software issues

Reviews.Author: Faith J. Hinkey
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy to have this tablet. I have wanted one for quite a while but was unsure which tablet would be the right one for me. After checking them out on the web I saw this one and decided it would be the one to meet my needs and desires. My husband wanted me to have it for a Christmas present. It exceeds my expectations. So glad I chose this tablet!
Reviews.Title: Absolutely WONDERFUL

Reviews.Author: K. Johanson
Reviews.Content: It's not always about saving money, even though the HDX is very, very competitively priced.  Sure, the Kindle family is geared to take advantage of the Amazon media content, but this tablet can do so much more.If you want to search the internet, hit your favorite web sites, or simply cruise web links or other hits, the HDX performs exceptionally well as long as you have an adequate internet connection.  The HDX is perfect for streaming movies and music whether it's Amazon content, or non-Amazon content such as Pandora, Netfilx, or other Kindle and/or Android aps.  The 7" is perfect for my travel needs--it's light enough to hold in one hand, the battery will easily last one day with very heavy use, and it's easy on the eyes as the screen/display is excellent.If you want portability and your needs are primarily email functions, browsing the internet, streaming media, using aps & playing games the HDX is hard to beat.
Reviews.Title: For the Novice in all of us...or the non-technigeeks  :)

Reviews.Author: MM
Reviews.Content: We love our Kindles more than our iPads! The typing is better, the internet is easier to use, and the selection and store is way better. We do use iPads for games, but we might not keep following Apple. It's so much nicer to have an Android platform for multi-tasking apps, etc.
Reviews.Title: Kindle's rock, and this one is even better than the last!

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle (so I don't have others to compare it to) but I love it. It is actually a gift for my mom but I had to set it up for her so I actually got to use it for awhile. It is very user friendly and easy to use. I wish you could "jazz" it up a little by changing the background picture or colors on it but you can't. My mom just uses it for games, internet, videos, but hasn't got into any books just yet. Amazon Prime account is a must with this I would think.
Reviews.Title: Great gift for my mom

Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Pretty slick little system. I'm not in love with the design. The back is not flat, part of it sticks out in a weird pattern but this is way faster than even my Kindle Fire. Having some problems with my Wi-Fi staying connected 1 but my wife's works great. Probably isolated issue. I'd say this is an iPad killer for sure.
Reviews.Title: Runs very fast, great package!

Reviews.Author: Edith C McDaniel
Reviews.Content: Because they were so helpful and patient with explaining things to me.  I am a senior citizen and I felt like they respected that.
Reviews.Title: Patient and Gentle

Reviews.Author: J. Allen
Reviews.Content: As everyone in my family reads we started with just the Kindle Paperwhite.  My girls still use theirs to read daily.  Last year I upgraded to the Kindle Fire and fell in love, was very rarely seen without my Fire.  When my husband decided that he wanted a Fire we debated what we were going to do and decided that I would upgrade and he would take my old Fire.  I bought the HDX from Best Buy and so far I am thrilled with it.  I have not noticed the purple/blue light at the edge that some people have mentioned and find the clarity on the screen to be stunning.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone...Buy and enjoy!!!
Reviews.Title: In Love with HDX

Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Cowen
Reviews.Content: This device is amazing and you will be happy you bought it. The Kindle Fire is an amazing device that displays images like as if they were lifelike.  The device features a fast 2.2GHz quad-core processor and 2GB of RAM for fast that run apps, games, and videos smoothly without an issues.  You will love this device and you can get free two day shipping with this offer.  So if you are in the market for a tablet you like this Kindle.  The marketplace from Amazon is great too.  There are thousands of books and games for free available to you.The thing that separates Amazon's Kindle devices is the fact that their customer service is world class. So many companies get this aspect of their businesses wrong but not Amazon. I had a Kindle device that died on me and they replaced it no questions asked. I have also had to call them occasionally and believe it or not I actually talked to a person, no recorded message. Amazon gets it when it come to their customer service.You will not regret getting this device.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7" is an exceptional device.

Reviews.Author: Tamara
Reviews.Content: Love it. My first experience with tablet. Owned for less than a month therefore still have not checked out all of the loaded applications, books or movies available on this device, have spent much of my time enjoying card and bingo games. I like being able to sync email and use the internet but still need to learn more about how to navigate typing on the keyboard. My laptop is now gathering dust! Yes I have recommended the Kindle Fire HDX to others.
Reviews.Title: Love My First Tablet

Reviews.Author: Tammy Shaffer
Reviews.Content: Everything I was looking for in a tablet, Blue light is very visible on one side! Occasionally shuts off when I am in the middle of something. Fast, very fast. Great for movies, audio books, music, and apps galore. They didn't joke when they set this baby up for the internet. My computer can only wish!  Have origami case, works well, no issues.
Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx 7"

Reviews.Author: Runner
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the wife as a replacement for her old Kindle. She absolutely loves it. She doesn't need to use her laptop much anymore. It looks great too.
Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Author: T. Smith
Reviews.Content: I ended up returning but if you're looking for simply an entertainment device this is fantastic.  And the sound!  Just awesome!But I couldn't live without access to the Google Play store and the lack of a physical home button was a bit of a nuisance.  I kept hitting the virtual button during normal typing... changed it for a Nook HD+, which was a fantastic bargain for only $139 at the time.
Reviews.Title: For simply an entertainment device this is fantastic

Reviews.Author: R. welsh
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad 2 and really don't like it for reading. Basically, it's a big iPhone. Good product but it is to big to lie in bed and read. Wife has a Fire original and likes it well enough. I decided to try the new Fire 7HDX. Received it and for a few days tried to come up with a reason why I should not like it and send it back and order an iPad mini2. Well I have to tell ya that this little device is as good as Amazon says! Sister in law has a Fire7HD and loves it. Comparing her Fire7HD with the 7HDX there's not much difference between the two. I have found the 7HDX more comfortable to cradle in the hand for reading in bed. Nice device. Purchased Poetic cover for it(read review) and will keep.
Reviews.Title: Fire 7HDX

Reviews.Author: Jean B. Holzer
Reviews.Content: Screen beautifully sharp, easy and intuitive to use, light-weight enough to hold comfortably for extended reading. On the light side, as a knitter I plan to make my own case for it, and a friend commented, "You must love it if you're going to make it a sweater!"
Reviews.Title: As great as the ads said it would be!

Reviews.Author: Breanna Penque
Reviews.Content: I can relate to every consumer who has looked at these reviews and questioned if the Kindle Fire HDX was a good choice for a gift (or possibly for yourself). For starters, the blue "glare" that is mentioned around the edge of the screen is there. I don't think its so horrible that you won't be able to read on the white screen. You can also change the text background in your books for example. you can read on a black background with white letters and the blue glare goes away. However, I received my kindle today and its already being shipped back. I don't think its a great buy for the price, yes the specs are great however the new Google nexus tablet is the same price for 32gb a frontal and back camera along with HD viewing capabilities. Further every tablet can download the kindle app or some type of e-reader app for books. The kindle tablet has limited access to the app market where android and apple are almost pretty equal. Amazon talks up a great game with this tablet, but I don't think it owns up to the price. Lastly I bought this to use almost as a portable laptop because I read you can VIEW Microsoft office documents. I first mis-read this for using Microsoft office. The kindle does not offer such a feature you can only simply view these things. Google you can't exactly use Microsoft office but does have word processing capabilities for all of us "on-the-go" and who can't afford the beautiful new window tablets. Hope this helps everyone on the fence!
Reviews.Title: Save your money and purchase Google/Android. Not enough for the price.

Reviews.Author: TwoTooth
Reviews.Content: There is now a note on the HDX product page about the glowing blue border. I believe this note is a recent addition, but it would've been easy to miss earlier. It's close to the top of the page and is under the heading We want you to know, followed by Learn more about design decisions to help make an informed purchase. This links to the following statement: "We want you to know...The Kindle Fire HDX 7" has perfect color accuracy (100% sRGB), and we wanted to share more details around our display design decisions that helped us achieve this.You may notice a very narrow, faint blue tint around the edge of the device when looking at items with a white background, such as books or web pages. All displays have some level of light emission around the edges, and the light on the Kindle Fire HDX 7" is blue due to the technology used to render perfect color accuracy. Most LCD displays use white LEDs, and then apply filters to extract the desired color. The result is oftentimes a compromise to tone and color accuracy, or--if attempting to address these compromises--an increase in battery consumption and, thus, device weight.We've taken a different approach. To achieve the perfect color accuracy on Kindle Fire HDX 7" at the lowest possible battery consumption and device weight, we used blue, not white, LEDs. Blue LEDs allow for a much more accurate and rich representation of color and result in an up to 20% improvement in power efficiency."So amazon's official stance is that the glowing blue border results from deliberate design decisions and is therefore not a manufacturing defect. We'll all have to decide for ourselves whether this is true and that all subsequent HDXs will have the same effect.I'm giving this three stars because I think amazon should've warned people about the blue border in advance. I do otherwise like the HDX in comparison to my first gen Fire and would give it four stars. I'm going to spend the next couple of weeks deciding whether I'll become accustomed enough to the blue border to no longer notice it (this is already happening to some extent).
Reviews.Title: Much to like; trying to get used to the glowing blue border

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Amazon continues to attempt to make sure you have to buy audible books through their audible store by failing to write the code in this new kindle that would make it compatible with oneclick digital which is the app the public library system uses to provide audible books for free (lends them just like a library book).Now they could include in their description that the app will not work with this particular kindle version but than people might not buy the tablet.  After an hour of being shuffled, disconnected and otherwisw aggravated with "customer service" I was told that the app writers would have to change their app to make it compatible.  Unlike most free apps that run constant ads the one click digital app is provided by our public library who can ill afford to make those software changes each time kindle develops a new version of its tablet.  Since we know previous kindles have had the software written to make them compatible we also must logically conclude that they could continue to do so.  It does not take a genius to figure out why  the new hdx was made incompatible.  Shame on you for effectively eliminating many peoples ability to obtain audible content.  As there are many children's books available to lend out this is particularly disgusting.  As a parent would I prefer my kids listen to someome reading a good book or playing games or movies with zero educational benefit?  I wish I hadn't traded in my old kindle which did have the software to work with the app.As I could not return this until Monday I decided to try the tablets other features.  The charging cord and plug that came with the device occasionally says it is the incorrect device to charge rapidly.The picture is nice but the 7 inch is so little that watching movies is not pleasant on the eyes, it gave me a headache holding the device close enough to see.The tablet frequently could not access the internet even though it showed I was connected in the settings.I guess they have to put out a new version yearly but truely unless there is significant technical improvement they should wait.
Reviews.Title: Cannot borrow audible books from your public library with this kindle. Shame on kindle.

Reviews.Author: FreeSpirit
Reviews.Content: QUICK SUMMARY - So far I think the Kindle Fire HDX is a great device given its performance, price point, and some really nice features though it is missing some features that would have been nice to have.1. FORM FACTOR - Compared to both the original Kindle Fire and the Fire HD, the HDX is lighter and thinner. Edges on the back are curved though not fully rounded, they still make it easy to grip the device. I can comfortably hold it in portrait mode in one hand between my thumb and palm and type with the other hand. The size and light weight makes it comfortable for one-handed reading for longer periods of time. There is a power button and volume +/- buttons on the back. The buttons are as easily accessible in landscape mode, but I'm still getting used to using them in portrait mode.2. SCREEN - This screen is the best in terms of resolution I have seen so far, sharper than its predecessors. There is no blurring of images or text under bright or dark background screens. Try pinch-zooming on an image, you will see that the integrity of the picture holds up pretty well despite zooming in real close. Reading e-books on this screen is easier on the eyes than reading on an iPad. I personally prefer to use my old e-ink Kindle to read books, but when traveling I plan to use the HDX. It doesn't strain the eyes as much as most other tablet screens that I have seen.3. SPEAKERS - I briefly compared speakers of the HD and HDX by playing the same song and maximizing the volume on both. The Fire HD's speakers were definitely louder when cranked up, but the difference was not significant. The speakers on the HDX however have better sound quality compared to the Mini for sure. That said, I personally don't buy tablets for their surround sound. I mostly use a tablet either with headphones or connected to a TV.4. STORAGE - I bought the 16GB version and I am already thinking I should probably upgrade to the 32GB. Of the 16GB, there is perhaps approximately 11-12GB available for end use, just an estimate - I could be off on this. This leaves little space if I want to store my entire music and video collection on the device, along with pictures and apps. For an extra $40, the 32GB is looking like a pretty good option. That being said, if you have most or all your collection stored on Amazon's Cloud Drive which you can stream to the HDX, the 16GB should be good.5. SPEED - The HDX is noticeably faster than the original Fire, and also feels improved over the Fire HD. Apps and videos load quicker. The most noticeable difference in speed is when browsing. Browsing on the Silk platform is smoother and less choppy. The difference is more evident when you go back from the HDX to browsing on an earlier generation Fire or another device.6. BATTERY - The HDX came with a micro-USB power charger! Advertised battery charging time is under 6 hours. Once fully charged, run time is said to be approximately 11 hours. Plenty for an average user like me, I use it probably 2-3 hours at most on any given day. This is supposed to have better battery life compared to that of its predecessor.7. CAMERA - The HDX 7" version comes with a front facing camera only for Skype or other video calls. I tried the front camera briefly, picture quality seemed good for Skype calls. The 8.9" however, comes with both a front and rear camera. I myself don't really use tablets to take pictures, I have my phone for that, but if you would really like to take pictures with this device, the 8.9" would be the way to go.8. WITH OR WITHOUT SPECIAL OFFERS - I have always bought the Fires with special offers to save $15. Figured I always had the option of paying this amount later and removing the ads if they annoyed me. However, the ads appear only on the lock screen, which I don't look at any way, so it doesn't bother me at all. If ads on the lock screen annoy you or if you want a more personalized lock screen, you can simply pay the extra $15 and it goes away.SOME REALLY NICE FEATURES:The following features, in my opinion, are a game changer in favor of the Kindle Fire HDX:1. MAYDAY - A one-button tap gets you online with a live support agent within an advertised 15 seconds (swipe down on the time on top of the screen, MayDay button appears as one of the options). You can see the agent, but the agent can only hear you (though I think the agent should be able to see you if you fired up the front camera, but that's only if you want the agent to see you). The agent can take control of the device and help with any questions you may have. I tried this service once, connected in 15-20 seconds, agent walked me through trying to stream video through Apple TV (wasn't compatible). Audio and video quality was good, but I just found it weird looking at someone while getting support. Maybe it'll take getting used to, I guess I'm just so used to getting support over the phone.As of now, I'm not sure if the MayDay service is provided for the life of the device, or for the warranty period only, or if there's a charge for the service once the warranty expires. If someone familiar with this can post a comment, that would be very much appreciated.2. OFFLINE PRIME CONTENT - This is another really cool feature that has been added. Prime videos can be downloaded to the device for offline viewing - extremely useful for travelers when you don't have wireless coverage or wi-fi available! However, note that not all movies or shows can be downloaded - there are titles that are available only for online viewing. I guess this probably has to do with the studios and what titles they have agreed to make downloadable. Nevertheless, as long as I can download 4-6 hours of content for a flight, that is all I need! Once I return from a trip, I can simply delete the movies and download new ones. With this feature, a lower storage capacity device becomes more viable because I don't need to keep downloaded movies on it at all times. I can delete and add as I wish. This feature also helps save on wireless minutes. You can download a movie at home over Wi-Fi and play it on the road without spending 3G minutes to stream.3. SECOND SCREEN - This feature is expected to be available soon so I haven't had a chance to try it yet. With Second Screen, the Kindle screen can be mirrored on to your TV. From the description, it appears that the HDX does more than just mirroring - you can stream a movie to your TV and then use the HDX to check emails, browse the web, etc - basically you are free to use your tablet for anything while it is streaming to your TV. If this is true, this is a major step ahead of what most other tablets are capable of doing in this regard. With my iPad, I can only mirror the screen but I can't use it for anything else while it is streaming to my TV. I am excited to try out this new feature, will post an update once this feature is made available.Note - In order to stream to your TV, you will need a Smart TV or a compatible device like PS 3/4. If you don't have a TV or device that can connect wirelessly, you will need a Miracast dongle that plugs into your TV's HDMI port and can be set up on your wireless network to communicate with the HDX. I bought a dongle like this for around $100 a few years ago, but I think you can now find them here on Amazon for $40-50 (you can search for "Miracast dongle"). It is possible some devices are unable to connect because of their software or other compatibility issues. So for devices like say the Apple TV or Google Chromecast, if they are incompatible right off the bat, you can search online for apps that make them compatible with the HDX.4. FREETIME - This is a neat feature for families with kids, both in terms of time and content management. (i) Time - We have two boys and we try to keep tablet time in check (one hour each day Fri-Sun). Sometimes it's difficult to get them to let go when their time is up, and the ensuing battle never ends! With this feature, we have the option to set a time limit so the kids know automatically when their time is up. We also have the option of leaving a category like reading without a time limit. (ii) Content - We can basically create a sub-profile within the HDX and choose what content we want to be available in there. This is like creating a tablet within a tablet in some ways. Within the sub-profile, we can choose what games, apps, videos they can watch, and also change the backdrop to make it look like a kid's tablet. Very thoughtfully executed design.CONs:1. NO HDMI - The HDX no longer has the Micro HDMI port that last year's Fire HD came with. I thought this was a great feature to connect the device to TVs particularly when traveling. This also made it easier to connect the device to audio receivers to blast music through external speakers. With HDMI gone, you simply have to rely on wi-fi to connect to a TV. Most hotels are not equipped with smart TVs in rooms yet. So if you absolutely want to use the HDX to watch videos on your hotel room TV, you will need to carry the Miracast dongle as well. If the lack of HDMI is a deal breaker for you, I think last year's Fire HD might be the way to go.2. NO EXPANDABLE STORAGE - It would have been helpful if the HDX came with a memory card slot that could be used to play movies or content from an external storage device. This would leave the HDX storage itself open for apps and other content that must be stored on the tablet to be used. Also, expandable storage would mean that the 16GB version of the device would be good enough. However, if you have most content on Amazon's Cloud or have purchased volumes of movies/music from Amazon, lack of this feature shouldn't be an issue for you.3. NO GOOGLE PLAY APPS - Even though it runs on an Android platform, the HDX doesn't have access to Google Play which means the selection of apps available on the HDX is limited.
