That being said, it is fairly simple to install apps that are not otherwise available within the Amazon app store. You can run a Google search on "how to add external apps (or Google Play apps) on Kindle Fire." It's pretty straightforward. I have found that the downloaded apps work great. Just remember to NOT root the Fire when installing these apps.4. 7" HDX LACKS REAR CAMERA - The 7" comes with only a front facing camera for video calls, it doesn't have a rear-facing camera. I personally don't need a rear camera on my tablet, but if you definitely need one, you can go for the 8.9" which has both a front and rear facing camera.ACCESSORIES:1. CASE - I bought two cases with the device - the Amazon Origami case and the Marware Origin case. Origami - more stylish, functional, various stand positions, excellent quality, $50. Marware - inexpensive at $20, stand, basic frugal choice.2. SCREEN PROTECTOR - The Kindle screen is pretty good against scratches, but I have put a screen protector on regardless. I got the Marware screen protector - good quality and keeps the screen clear like there's nothing there.3. MIRACAST DONGLE - There are several adapters you can find here on Amazon. You will need this for streaming to your TV if you don't have a Smart TV or a compatible wireless device like PS3/4.4. CHARGERS - If you need to purchase additional chargers or cables, regular Micro-USB chargers/cables will work fine.BOTTOM LINE - Compared to the previous Kindle Fire versions and other tablets that I have used, the HDX is lighter, faster, has an excellent screen, and is loaded with some amazing features. All this for $229 makes the device a great choice. Whether or not to buy the HDX is entirely a personal decision. In my humble opinion, the choices:(i) If you have a recent tablet like say the Fire HD and are contemplating an upgrade, the upgrade may be worthwhile if you absolutely must have some of the new features (like Second Screen or offline Prime content).(ii) If the new features are not that meaningful for your purposes, it may be better to stay with your current device and wait for the next round of device releases.(iii) If this is the first tablet you are considering, scroll to the top and add to cart.
Reviews.Title: Great performance and value

Reviews.Author: Sclark
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle Fire HDX, based on all of the favorable reviews.  My only complaint is that the device is not secure, right out of the box.  While the Kindle may be great at what it is intended to do, I pretty much rejected it due to a lack of security and regard to my Amazon account.  I am writing this review as a word of caution to others who may order it:When you order the Kindle, Amazon will ask you if you want to pre-register it.  They are doing this as there were many complaints of registrations failing after customers received the device, so they pre-register it for you before shipping, to cut down the amount of calls to their support.  The bad part of this is that, straight out of the box, you can click on "Shop Amazon" and go straight into your account.  The app, or the Kindle itself, does not ask for your credentials.  What this means is that my Kindle could have been mis-delivered, someone could have opened the box, powered on the Kindle, and had immediate access to my Amazon account (settings, Order History....everything).  I was even able to go shopping and could have made purchases, all without being prompted for my account credentials.Even with a passcode lock on the device, once registered and accessed, the Kindle prompts you no further for your Amazon credentials.  For some folks this might be OK, but for others who loan their Kindle to their kids, friends, or are just plain security conscious, this may be an issue for them.  It would be nice to see Amazon step up security and regard for customer's privacy on their portable devices.
Reviews.Title: Not a secure device

Reviews.Author: anaconda
Reviews.Content: I thought I was gonna like this... I had this for a week and I noticed the screen flicker that haunts this device... Switching between screens and on some games the screen brightness will flicker for 2 to 5secs I talked to mayday and chat and they had me do a factory reset and it still did it.... 3 device replacements later and still the flicker.. My gfs kindle does it to, also also each device I had the color tone of the screen was different at the same brightness... Plus u can side load apps but they won't always show up on the home screen and some will stop working and u will have to unintstall them, u will have to stick with the amazon App Store which sucks... Nothing updates fast ...  I urge u to consider the nexus 7 instead and just download the kindle app if that's what your into, of do what I did and just lay down the extra cash and get the iPad mini with retina....  The only pro with the hdx is the device is fast but other that that it's not worth your time
Reviews.Title: Piece of crap

Reviews.Author: Chrisie Ward
Reviews.Content: I have been a Kindle owner for many years. Bought the Kindle DX, then upgraded to the Kindle HD last year and purchased Amazon prime for the Prime streaming of TV and movies. So when they announced the new HDX would allow for downloading prime movies and TV shows I thought it would be fantastic. I use the Kindle for reading alot and also for watching the movies and TV episodes while exercising. So I thought with the new HDX and being able to download the prime TV/movies, it would be perfect for those hotels which have very poor wifi in the fitness room and I could also watch movies/TV on the plane.Well, watching the movies and TV shows are much better than the HD, but it comes at a cost, and to me it's a big cost. The reading experience on the new HDX is terrible. The blue/purple line is definitely noticeable, not only when reading but also on anything with a white background, including email and web pages. This is not actually a major problem for me but I can see how some people would find it distracting. My major issue with the HDX is the color of the backgrounds while reading. As noted in some previous reviews, the black background is not black, it's grey but my biggest problem is the white background. It's not white, it's off white/light yellow. When comparing to an iPhone/iPad and even the previous HD, it definitely has a yellow tint. The fact that it's a little bit of a yellow background wouldn't be such a big deal, but it's blotchy. Most of the screen will be a yellowish color while there are small sections that are the bluish white color. I notified Amazon of this and they sent me out a new one but the new one was actually worse than my original. The "blotchiness" was larger and the yellow color was more noticeable. Plus, the blue/purple color was more noticeable as well. I also went to Best Buy to look at the HDXs and the yellow color was on those as well. This yellow color in a lighted environment is subdued, but when you're reading at night in bed with the lights off, the yellow color and blotchiness is very noticeable.Another disappointment is the battery power. The battery doesn't last anywhere near as long as the HD. As I said, I read alot and before with the HD I could go weeks without having to recharge which was great with the amount I travel so I wouldn't have to bring the cords because I could just recharge back at home. However, with the HDX, I have to recharge every 3-4 days which means I have to bring the cords with me when I travel.The Mayday feature is NOTHING like they show on TV. The video is not very clear and the audio is very delayed. The service reps also don't know anything other than telling you to reset the device and then if that doesn't work, someone will call you back on the phone, thereby not even using the Mayday feature.Also, the screen on the HDX is no better in the sun than the HD, which I was led to believe it would be better. Not sure if this was a misunderstanding on my part, but it's not better than the HD. In comparison with the iPad (mini), the iPad is way better to read in the sun and I don't mean just a little better, but way better.I'm just very disappointed. I've never had any problems with Amazon before but it just seems they didn't think things through on the HDX. The Kindle has always been a great reading device, so it seems they wanted to improve the viewing experience for games and movies/TV to be better than Apple. But they did it at the expense of the reading experience, which is a big disappointment for those of us that like to read.I could continue asking for new HDXs, but what's the point? I've already seen 4 and they've all had this problem, and the replacements could be worse than the original like my one replacement already was. Do I go back to the HD? If I do that I lose the ability to download the prime TV/movies which is a great feature. Do I get a Kindle paper white for reading? Well, then I have to carry 2 tablets with me which is ridiculous. Should I purchase the 8.9 inch which supposedly doesn't have some of these issues? Well, the 8.9 inch is bigger, bulkier, heavier and more expensive and space/weight is a premium with the amount I travel. Do I begin using my iPad mini? Then again I lose the ability of the prime downloading. So I guess I'll keep the original HDX and hope Amazon addresses the reading issues on the next upgrade, but with the way they've been responding with these issues on the HDX, it seems like they don't think the issues are a problem.So, if you'll primarily use the 7 inch HDX for gaming, and viewing videos, you'll probably really enjoy it. However, if you plan to read a lot on the HDX, this is probably not the device for you.
Reviews.Title: Disappointing

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jlambert1982"
Reviews.Content: Pros:The size.  I have an original iPad and an 8.9 Fire HD from last year.  I never thought I'd be want the smaller size, but this is perfect.  I no longer play games on my phone, b/c this thing is easy enough to carry around I take it everywhere.  In fact, if I didn't use my phone's hotspot to give this thing connectivity I would consider dropping my phone all together and using this thing to make calls from.The screen.  This thing looks amazing.  A co-worker has the new iPad Air. Side by side we both think this little guy blows it out of the water.  We pull up the same images from google and it is easy to see the difference.The performance.  My biggest complaint about the 8.9 Kindle Fire HD was that it was laggy.  Pulling up apps would take too long compared to my Galaxy S 4 or my son's iPod touch.  Apps would crash before they opened.  Videos would stall between clicking play and the video actually playing.  This little powerhouse has eliminated almost all of that.  Apps still crash, but I'll get to that later.Cons:Storage.  I live on a farm.  Beyond satellite and cell coverage I have no options for high speed internet.  I do get LTE where I live, but that is on a limited basis, and my satellite broadband has a data cap as well.  It would be nice to download season's of television while I am at work or travelling and store them on my device.  64GB seems like a lot, but between apps, books, audiobooks, and HD video, it still fills up fast.  A 128GB version would have been worth it to me.Video output.  On my Kindle Fire HD I could bring an HDMI cable with me wherever I went, and as long as there was free HDMI input on the television, I could watch my videos.  Now I have to watch through my PS3 (which I could already do with Amazon Instant Video) or the newer Samsung televisions (but not my 2011 55 inch LED).  Kind of frustrating.  Even my kid's iPod Touch has HDMI out with an adapter.App availability.  I love Amazon App Store.  It is a lot easier to navigate than Google Play, and you don't have the multitude of worthless apps.  However, there are tons of apps that I use on my phone that just are not available through Amazon.  I use Google Voice to check voicemails and send messages.  While I can do that through the Silk browser, why can't I have that option?  Everyone I know who owns a Kindle Fire has their own personal complaint about an app they can't use.Summary:I love my HDX.  To me, this is the perfect size for a tablet, and this thing performs like a monster.  It has replaced all my other tablets.  I still have a very large library of movies and TV shows in iTunes, and it continues to grow b/c of my wife's love of her iPhone and my kid's reliance on their iPods, so I can't just shut down my iTunes account yet.  For me personally, however, I'll never have to use iTunes again.  Everything this device is supposed to do, it does great.  It is a great e-reader.  It is a great video player.  It is a great music player.  I started reading comics again when I bought the 8.9 inch Fire HD last year because of how great that device was for the comic book format.  The 7 inch HDX is just as good.  Note taking, game playing, time killing.....You name it, this device does it.Right now I don't know who I wouldn't recommend this to.  Thinking about spending 150 bucks on your kids and buying them a LeapPad Ultra?  Spend the extra money up front and get them a device that is worth the money in the long run.  Between the free apps and device quality, that is a no brainer.Have grandparent who watches old TV channels and reads books?  Give them this and tell them to pay for Prime, and cancel their cable bill.My only complaints are minor.  I knock off one star because I don't like the idea of being locked into their ecosystem of apps.  That is very Apple of them, and while I understand the business to it, I still don't appreciate it.  If I could make any improvements, I wish Amazon would let me import my library of videos from iTunes to their cloud like they did my music.  If they could make that happen, I would be a fully converted form .mac fanboy.Buy without hesitation if you are a Prime member or just starting your digital video library.  I would hesitate slightly if I had thousands invested in iTunes videos and apps, but even then, for $230, it may be worth it just to see if you like it better.
Reviews.Title: Very Impressive

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I've previously owned one other tablet -- the iPad 1.  I received it as a birthday present ~3 years ago, and sold it last year back to Apple as part of their buyback program.  I liked the iPad, but found it slightly too heavy, wide, and slow (after upgrading iOS).  The screen resolution also was subpar compared to modern standards.Fast forward to today and I've dove head-first back into the tablet world with the 7" Kindle Fire HDX.  All of my complaints stated above are no longer apparent with the Kindle Fire HDX.  It is light, narrow (can easily grip with one hand, although not as narrow as the Nexus 7), and whip-fast.  Screen resolution is as crisp as they come.My biggest complains are that (1) the ads are semi-annoying, and (2) the whole "user experience" appears to revolve around the consumer buying a bunch of stuff from Amazon.  With the Nexus 7 or iPad, there is less emphasis on "buying stuff" and more emphasis on "doing stuff" (e.g. a less commercial experience).Still, for the price ($179 on Cyber Monday), I can't complain too much.  I will say, though, that depending on the promotion at the time, if the Nexus 7 and Kindle HDX are the same price, I'd probably actually prefer the Nexus 7 for a more traditional tablet experience.  Sorry Amazon.  Still, nice tablet at a good price
Reviews.Title: Nice tablet but still room for improvement

Reviews.Author: mllecheree
Reviews.Content: I should have bought the 32G.Pretty much everything is an improvement over the HD: speed, the Mayday button, audio, clarity, viewing angle, weight, ability to stream wirelessly to the TV (but needs extra equipment or the right TV). It's light enough that I'm thinking about abandoning my Paperwhite. The cube charger is included in the box, so that's one accessory you don't have to buy. Speaking of accessories,  the origami case is nifty and very stable in landscape, but a touch heavy and it's slightly tilted in portrait.It's my own fault I didn't get the 32G.  If I'd read the blurb carefully, I'd have seen that one can download some of the Amazon Prime Instant Videos. This comes in handy when streaming Wi-Fi isn't an option -- like on a plane or at my parents' house, but that's another story.
Reviews.Title: There's only one thing I regret about buying the HDX 7", Wi-Fi, 16G . . .

Reviews.Author: J. Dionne
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed using my Kindle Fire, but I had to upgrade it when the new Kindle Fire HD was released.  In for a penny, in for a pound -- I had to upgrade to the Kindle Fire HDX after reading all the improvements to an already excellent product. I was somewhat put off by the price for the 7" 64GB HDX, but now that I've had it a week I believe it worth every penny.CON: the mini HDMI port is gone (boo hoo), and I had to purchase a new cover. (it is smaller than the Fire HD)PRO: just about everything else and comes with the USB charger plug too.It is fast, and I mean really fast.  Downloads are 1000% faster (my estimation) than the Kindle Fire HD I replaced.  The resolution is amazing.The "look and feel" has changed a bit -- which I am still adapting to -- but no so much that I need to learn a 'new device' all over again.  In fact, I am already growing to appreciate the new skin -- and the good-ole HD top line bar menu is still there like an old friend waiting to lend a hand.I purchased the WiFi only version because I use my cell phone's AP WiFi point when no other free WiFi is available.  The Wispernet support is not a requirement for me needs.All-in-all this is by far the best Android device I have owned, and I have purchased much more expensive devices from other vendors.  Amazon has a winner with the HDX.I highly recommend the 7" version for the "person on the go."  It fits into my back pocket, all-be-it somewhat snug.
Reviews.Title: One word sums up my review -- WOW!

Reviews.Author: snapdragon463
Reviews.Content: Not at all disappointed that I held off buying any of the previous kindles, and I really wanted one so it was hard.  Figured I'd wait and see how much they might improve them and I am really glad I did now.  I absolutely love mine, was truly impressed with all the functions this tablet has.  I already have the Samsung galaxy 10.1 tablet with google, apps, so I was not going to miss the fact that this one did not.  The picture quality, like others have stated is fantastic, along with many other things such as Mayday, which I have not tried.  Thought I would probably have to use Mayday since this was my first kindle, nope.  Took it out of the box, charged it up-mine was at 80% when I plugged it in, and within 2 hours was at 100%.  Have not used all the functions yet that this tablet has since I've only had it one day, but I will get ALOT of use out of it for sure.  I mainly wanted a 7 inch tablet that I could carry with me that wasn't heavy that you could read a book, watch a movie, access the internet etc. when I am out somewhere.  To me, the setup was easy which was a great thing for me.  As far as the purple haze everyone is complaining about-it is barely noticeable to me and very faint on the white screen and does not show up most of the time on mine if that is any help.  Also I am glad I ordered the 64GB-will definitely be putting stuff on it.  The orgami case is a perfect match for this tablet also, so I wouldn't hesitate to order it. I am a happy camper with my new Kindle!
Reviews.Title: First Kindle Tablet Ever Owned-LOVE IT!

Reviews.Author: Telemachus
Reviews.Content: This is a great little tablet and much improved from the early Kindle Fire.  On the downside, I was a bit confused when I first turned it on and could not find the MayDay feature.  However, I soon realized that the operating system hadn't been updated since July,  Once updated, everything worked wonderfully.  It's a nice feeling to turn on a device and it's automatically connected to your account and information.The screen is beautiful and the the processor is very snappy,  I wanted something more compact for reading and traveling.  I like something the size of a paperback.  My primary tablet is an iPad.  I was able to sync my calendar and contacts with my iCloud account using CalDav.  No problem.One of the criticisms I've heard is that you are bound to the native apps on the Amazon store.  The Silk Browser is a much improved native browser.  Loads fast.  Works well.  Like my contacts and calendar I wanted some continuity with my iPad and Mac environment, so I side-loaded the Chrome browser.  Works perfectly.  Instructions for side loading and using CalDav are all readily available online.  However, if you are not comfortable with computers, stick with Silk.  It's good, it's integrated and it's straightforward.  However, if you like what you like...you can side-load.I'm surprised at  the sound. Given the size of the speakers in this small form-factor, the sound is surprisingly good and at a decent intensity.The one feature I'd like to see is an improved method for organizing apps.  However, this is a device designed to consume media and that focus is reflected in the interface design.  Overall, this tablet is a great alternative to more expensive tablets.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire has come of age with this edition!

Reviews.Author: Cory Purcell
Reviews.Content: For what I paid for it I was expecting it to do a lot more.First the Pros - Good picture and sound quality, super fast, and the mayday button does work well.Cons - You can't personalize it, whenever you turn it on, instead of having an option to see a picture of your choice, you get an ad.The home screen is plain and boring.I opted for the 64 GB because it doesn't have an SD card slot. I like the option of having things on the cloud, but I would like to be able to put a card in it too.It doesn't come with a basic calculator...You shouldn't have to download a calculator app.It doesn't give you notifications, for email/messages...The app store doesn't have an official Facebook messenger app (only 3rd party apps to get you Facebook messages)The battery takes FOREVER to charge and the battery life isn't the greatest!Fresh out of the box I had to charge it for an hour just to get it to turn on. Then you need at least 30% battery to download any updates...so that's at least another hour or so.So basically its a Media player...Music, Movies, a very limited amount of games and apps.So I will be returning this device, and getting something with a little more functionality.
Reviews.Title: Hey I got the new Kindle...an hour later..."This is all it does?"

Reviews.Author: Mark J
Reviews.Content: My primary tablet use is media consumption, mostly movies, and wireless display of Power Point, videos and documents.I am a prime member and have been protesting/boycotting the Amazon tablet and movies because they allow streaming on Apple but not Android unless you have their product and it seems to go against Amazon's mantra that stresses service as its key tenet.  Amazon pushed me to Google movies and other tablets with business features.However, the new ability to download for no additional cost much of its Prime content for off line viewing for up to 30 days for each downloaded movie/show and the new wireless video display via Miracast was too much to pass up, or at least try.Incidentally, I bought the new Nexus 7 at the same time but returned it because you can not stream movies download to the unit.  One is required to delete the saved Google purchased movie from the unit and stream via the internet.  GO FIGURE.  Im not required to do this with my other android tablet.  FYI, you have to perform the os upgrade for the Nexus 7 to stream.I bought the 16GB, 7 inch HDX.  I did not notice the purple hazing some have reported.  Sixteen gigs seems to be okay because you have the option of what quality movie you download.  I think I will be able to save 15 movies or so, more than enough for a weekend.The display is excellent, the unit charges rather quickly and battery life good so far.I used a Netgear Push2TV to connect wirelessly to the TV.  It works great even without the latest Netgear update.  I didnt even notice a lag.  Only gripe is you have to enter into settings, then display and then connect, versus other units have a mirror connect when you swipe down the notifications.  You can disconnect more easily.NOTE OF CAUTION IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE CONNECTING:  All of these Netgear Push 2TV 3000's are not created equal.  I have three of these units, two that I have had awhile and connect to WIDI, though I have given up WDii and Windows 8, but wont connect to Miracast. These units say they have accepted and been updated, but they arent.I bought another unit two days ago and while it wont update, it works with both Miracast and WIDI (Windows 7).  If your screens simply instructs you to connect your PC/Tablet/Phone, you have the right model.  If you are asked to switch between Miracast v Widi, probably not gonna work for you with Miracast.  Hope this helps.I streamed documents and powerpoint, too.  Dropbox is not available, but Amazon's Cloud Drive may be a work around.I downloaded several movies for off line viewing on a road trip and the unit worked great.I expect I will buy a couple of more as stocking stuffers.
Reviews.Title: Great Features-was expecting to return, but the unit won me over

Reviews.Author: Peter J. Weiss
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire hdx exudes quality in every aspect of the device. I can honestly say that there is no other tablet that provides the value for the cost.Screen: 5 out of 5In order to really appreciate the screen, you need to download at "best quality" an hd show or movie from amazon prime. Then you need to compare it to an hd video on another tablet. The screen color and clarity is absolutely amazing.Sound: 5 out of 5Coming from an Apple device owner, I never expected much for sound quality from tablets until I got the kindle fire hdx. The sound is crystal clear and loud! I don't quite understand how it works because I have tried covering the sound ports but the sound is still loud like it may be coming from around the screen as well. Try it, you will be impressed.Build Quality: 5 out of 5You can tell that this tablet has a magnesium frame built in. There is zero flex when holding or moving the tablet around. Compared to the Nexus 7 which also has a rubberized grip, you can tell that the nexus 7 is plastic and the kindle is metal on the inside. The build quality rivals the iPad mini.Processing: 5 out of 5Phenomenal speed doing any task you can imagine. Everything is instant with no delay at all. Loading up videos on youtube is much faster than on an iPad, which is most likely due to the dual antenna wifi for the kindle hdx. There is zero stutter playing hd games like Fifa Soccer 14 and watching 1080p videos.Battery Life: 5 out of 5This was the one aspect I expected to suffer being that it is an android based device. Battery life never seems to live up to what the manufacturer claims because android seems to just drain the battery. I have been using the device for a couple days and so far, it really does live up to the claims. After watching several hours of video I still find the battery life around 80%. Charging is also quick. I expect that it will only take a couple hours to go from 0% to 100% charged.Overall: 5 out of 5This is THE tablet to own for 2013-2014. Amazon has set the price of the kindle fire hdx to dominate the tablet market. Unlike other tablets such as the nexus 7, the kindle fire hdx doesn't sacrifice build quality to bring the cost down. This tablet should honestly be $329 starting like the iPad mini, but Amazon is pricing the tablet to acquire market share and make back money from app, video, book, and Amazon purchases. Even if your not a prime member, you should buy this tablet and become a prime member because it is very worth it. With all the new kindle fire hdx owners, the Amazon prime showcase should expand significantly too as Amazon brings more content to customers.
Reviews.Title: Best in class

Reviews.Author: Watchguy
Reviews.Content: Display is awesome. Website don't render as well as iPad. However, I love the size of this thing. I found the 8.9 to be too rectangular. The 7" seems to fit perfectly in your hand.
Reviews.Title: I actually like this better than the 8.9

Reviews.Author: carey
Reviews.Content: I bought this after breaking my Google Nexus 7 tablet. Luckily I have 30 days on this, because I think I am going to return it. Buying apps is incredibly annoying, because even if it's free they send you and email, and it clogs your bank statements. A lot of times you have to stab the screen to click a link, and hope it actually works. It can't play the radio and record videos at the same time.The keyboard is weird on it as well. It also has to reload every tab you have open when you try to click back on it. Going back to the Google tablet. Way more efficient.
Reviews.Title: touch screen; beyond annoying.

Reviews.Author: Giuseppe Baldi-Castro
Reviews.Content: My daughter, who's an avid reader, loves this kindle. Not only can she read books, she can listen to music, play games and check on her social media as well.Great tablet!
Reviews.Title: Gift for Daughter

Reviews.Author: Jennifer Ewing
Reviews.Content: I DO NOT LIKE THAT THE POWER BUTTON IS LOCATED AT THE BACK OF DEVICE.  IF U HAVE A COVER IT HAS TO COME OFF EVERY TIME
Reviews.Title: power button

Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Portrait Painter"
Reviews.Content: And it does not disappoint. I love being able to read out of doors, and I like the better (clearer) fonts, and the crispest screen.The sound is every bit as good as I expected, and the speed is phenomenal.
Reviews.Title: I've wanted this for some time

Reviews.Author: Mary Maple
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom thinking it would help her connect to the internet with no fuss no muss, but when I set it up for her, it took me nearly a week to really get familiar with how it works and only AFTER I downloaded a pay for guide did I discover it has one built in, but is hard to find.I would not recommend it for new users. If you own a smart phone, you will adapt quickly, but if you are a standard lap top user, this think will make you want to pull your hair out and requires some practice.The worst thing about it is that it is set up to sell you stuff on Amazon, so instead of guiding you to free services like Hulu unpaid, it takes you to services you have to pay for and won't let you access the free ones unless you are really persistent and crafty about it.It is really easy to hit the wrong button and be convince to download or buy something you don't want.Other than that, the video quality is fantastic, the screen, though small is easy to read and can be enlarged without compromising things too much and this think has better stereo than my boom box and gets really good battery life.The camera is not very good. It takes decent pix, but only forward facing, so you cannot see what you are taking a picture of unless you are doing a selfie!I like the thing and it has good speed and connection and quality audio and video, but the touch screen type is awkward and slow and the learning curve pretty steep even for someone who has used computers for years, but in a limited capacity it is a fun thing to have and well worth the purchase.
Reviews.Title: Good little tablet, but does have some issues

Reviews.Author: Kathleen L. Dunn
Reviews.Content: The lack of a usable users manual and instructions with the device are a big drawback to purchase of this Kindle. I finally resorted to purchasing a instruction book from a non-Amazon author and was able to find out how to actually use it productively. For the price, the chintzy elimination of something as simple as an instruction manual is a poor reflection on Amazon customer service standards.Now that I have finally figured out how to use it, though, I do love this Kindle and have been getting a lot of use out of both the e-books and watching both streaming and downloaded movies, as well as surfing the web.
Reviews.Title: Love the product, but...

Reviews.Author: Phillip Marshall
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great! Wish that the battery life was longer & that you could take pictures with it, but for the price it's quite a value.
Reviews.Title: PM'S Review

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my nephew and one for my niece.  Clearly they are in love with the Kindle...I hardly hear from them anymore.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: David Bitting "Ding Dong Daddy"
Reviews.Content: I received this for Christmas. I use this mostly for reading, music and web surfacing. The videos I have watched have been very clear. Amazing that one carry a hundred books in one hand. So many books so little time as they say.
Reviews.Title: A Wonderfull Device

Reviews.Author: A Rich
Reviews.Content: Amazon puts out such great products that I feel anything I say will fall short of their quality.I love that they show up already set up with your information so you can immediately start using it without all the hassle of setting it up. It doesn't come bogged down with a bunch of pre-installed junk that no one uses.  I use just about everything they sent pre-installed.The updated Fire OS is sleek and beautiful with convenient updates like the ability to group books into genres or some other personalized organization. The apps and books run so smoothly I forget I'm on a tablet instead of a computer. Every corner of the screen reacts to my touch (which my work IPad occasionally fails at) without me having to fight it.I absolutely love the ability to watch Prime videos on this. It's more convenient lugging this little guy around over my clunky laptop.And unlike my laptop the battery lasts for days! They've definitely improved the battery life over the previous versions of the Kindle Fire HD (still think they were great products though).I'm excited to keep following the Kindle Fire through it's evolution and later generations and will continue increasing how much I rely on Amazon products and services because they focus so much on quality..
Reviews.Title: What compliments will suffice?!

Reviews.Author: Jen Woolsey
Reviews.Content: I loved my old Kindle Fire, which was my first, but after a couple of years the internal docking port became loose and it started to get very hard to charge without alot of manipulation. I kept it as a spare for my husband who's only a periodic reader, and will keep it until it no longer works. My new Fire is wonderful, though it took some getting used to, where the different settings are, etc. Who reads manuals? The only other thing that I find weird is that I feel like the camera is staring at me! Overall though, I love it.
Reviews.Title: Love this device!

Reviews.Author: Isis
Reviews.Content: I primarily use my Kindle for gaming and probably use it at least and hour per day.  Good resolution and speed, and the screen size make it easy for gamers.  Also have some books downloaded but I prefer the feel of a book in my hand, but use the Kindle books when I travel.  Buy one...you won't regret it!
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle!

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: No question it beats the other tablets in the this category. Better than Ipad mini. I am a Galaxy product fan but Kindle fire is better as a tablet. Better display, functionality and easy to carry.
Reviews.Title: Great Reader and tablet

Reviews.Author: M. Harris
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Kindle Fire is the streaming video from Amazon and the ease of downloading books. I was very happy until my wireless service stopped working, and then my wifi wouldn't connect either. So I called Amazon. I had a lovely conversation with a young woman in the Philippines who seemed to be home taking care of children in the background. After several efforts to fix the problem (all of which I assured her I had already tried using the troubleshooting site on amazon), she told me to call AT&T.; Nice. I tried and they said it's an Amazon issue. Back to Amazon I went and was again met with zilch. Can I visit an Amazon store? Nope. Because there are none. And that's exactly why my next purchase is going to be an ipad. But I will probably purchase it through Amazon!
Reviews.Title: HORRID CUSTOMER SERVICE!

Reviews.Author: DonatoADC "DonatoADC"
Reviews.Content: I've owned the 7" HDX 32GB since Christmas and am selling it on eBay to get either an iPad mini-retina or Nexus 7, thus I could not live within the statement  made above.  The HDX does its primary role, that of consuming Amazon prime media (I'm a Prime member) very well.  It's screen is sharp and the color rendering is very good so reading books and watching movies you rent, buy or get free as an Amazon prime member is a very good experience.  Thus, if you can live within that construct I think you will be happy.My problem was I wanted it to do more, and there's where it gets smoked by the admittedly far more expensive but also admittedly far more capable iPad min retina and also the similarly priced Nexus 7.  I found I needed my tablet to do some serious internet surfing, but folks, let's be honest, Silk may have improved over time but it's still arguably the worst browser out there.  It is slow, clunky, and struggles to render accurately many websites I visit.  And yes I did install the Dolphin bowser-not as straight forward a task as I'd hoped-and it's better than Silk but still weak compared to surfing on an iPad mini or a Nexus 7.Then there is the Amazon app market, or lack thereof more accurately.  The apps are poor in their number and often horrendous in their quality when compared to the Apple app store or Google play.  Yes, yes I know you can root the HDX and access Google Play, but if you're going to go to all that trouble why not just buy an equally affordable and very more capable Nexus 7 running stock Android?Finally, I have to say the stability of the Fire OS based on archaic the Android Jelly Bean version the HDX uses is bug ridden and ineptly designed and almost forces you to root it just so you can install an updated Android OS and dump the pitiful carrousel launcher for something far better.So, if you can live within the HDX's limited role of consuming Amazon media I think you will be happy, but the moment you try to go beyond that I think you'll envy anyone with an iPad mini or Nexus 7.
Reviews.Title: It is what it claims to be and if you can live within its limitations it's fine.

Reviews.Author: Vinny
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting the Mayday button: Prime: Movies: Share your screen: print functionality (for now) to name a few for Kindles bought through the .au Amazon store then you won't get them.  This is disappointing as I am paying the same price in US dollars as anyone buying their Kindle in the US.  Therefore through my purchase of a Kindle am I not subsidising US buyers?  Hopefully Amazon provides these features in the future through a software upgrade.Besides that, the table is amazingly fast.  Much faster than the iPad2.  Sound is great.  And there is a good selection of apps on hand.So besides that please Amazon improve your support for international customers!
Reviews.Title: Australian (international version) lacking

Reviews.Author: Shirley McCammon
Reviews.Content: I love it . I had one of the oldest Kindle's .The only thing I could do was read on it, didn't know what I was missing.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7"

Reviews.Author: Nuc
Reviews.Content: This was for my 12 year old whose school has a BYOD policy and has lessons specifically designed for tabler/PC users. He initially had a Kindle Fire HD but it didn't have a camera so we bought him this. He loves it and it works great for school as well.The screen is great and looks really nice watching video. It has a decent camera and works nicely as a tablet. The only other tablet we have is an old Acer, so it's not fair to compare.It does everything we have wanted to do with a tablet - so I guess that's all we can ask. would definitely buy more and recommend. For my and my old eyes I prefer the 8.9", but this is still real nice.
Reviews.Title: Love the tablet

Reviews.Author: SMcQuirk
Reviews.Content: This was a great price, shipped lightning fast, I'll be buying from this seller again. We purchased this for our mom/grandma for mother's day, she loves it. This little fire will do everything she does on line and then some. we went with the fire hdx because this is an e reader, a browser, it plays amazon prime video, and it will skype. I would recommend this to everyone if your looking for a multi-function tablet it's wonderful

Reviews.Author: Felicia
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle. It's just like a mini computer.reading on it is awesome.and it has great back light when reading on the dark.
Reviews.Title: Awesome! Kindle

Reviews.Author: Daisy Cook
Reviews.Content: I like my KIndle very much.  I  have had a couple problems with it but I think I have them worked out.  I did write and you told me to call but so far I haven't did that but may later.  The book section is why I bought it and I read a lot.  I would like to be able to have just the  names of the books in alphabetical order with no photo as the photos takes up lots of room on the Kindle.  So far I haven't been able to do that.  Those two things are why I wasn't able to rate it at five stars.  But, I also think Amazon puts too many of their products on my Kindle to buy.  I like Amazon and I go to my computer a lot to buy, but really don't want all those things on my Kindle.

Reviews.Author: Michele M. Marks
Reviews.Content: I like the product, but I don't understand why it disconnects from the internet so frequently.  I called May day, and it disconnected before I could speak to tech support.  It seems that support feels the problems lies with our internet set up and is unaware of anyone else with the same problem.  I have a hard time believing I'm the only one.  Otherwise, I like the device and use it more often than our laptop.
Reviews.Title: Disappointed in Internet Connectivity

Reviews.Author: Michael S. Bell
Reviews.Content: I got the Kindle Fire HD last year and I thought it was the best thing in the world. That is until I got the Fire HDX! This tablet is so freaking fast! And the screen is Amazing! The sound is also just like my Fire HD the best sound of all tablets. My brother has an I-pad and when he seen my HDX, now he wants one. I have noticed the blue line around the screen that some complain about hampers reading, but I didn't buy it for reading. I don't think any of the Kindle Fire's were built for reading they were built for music,games, and movies. If I want read,I just use my normal Kindle for that. The Fire HDX is in my opinion the best tablet out there for music,games,movies,NetFlix,and Amazon Prime. I wouldn't recommend it for strictly reading.
Reviews.Title: This Tablet look's amazing!

Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: LOVE my kindle fire HDX, was very upset because my first unexpectedly died but was able to contact Amazon customer service and they were very kind and replaced it for me.
Reviews.Title: love it

Reviews.Author: JT "royalbj"
Reviews.Content: I like this because it is compact, larger than my phone, but not as large as a laptop.  I like the color and the additional uses more than my old paperwhite Kindle.  I do not like that when reading, the words are not hyperlinked to a dictionary as the paperwhite was and I don't like skipping over words.  Or I don't know how to hyperlink the two together, but I don't recall having to do anything special with the paperwhite that I had.  Oh well, you get new features and they always manage to remove some features.  I wish when new products come out, they would leave all the features in the previous version and either improve them or just add on; never take away.
Reviews.Title: Light to carry

Reviews.Author: jesch
Reviews.Content: When I bought this tablet I was considering an iPad Mini or a Nexus 7 tablet. After reading some reviews, the specs on this device seemed really good, and the price was a lot better than the iPad, so I chose the Kindle Fire HDX. From a hardware standpoint, this tablet is pretty nice. It is lightweight, and has a nice display. There is one really big problem with this tablet though - it doesn't give you access to the Google Play store and the standard Google apps. Being an Android based tablet, I had assumed that these would be available. There are some good basic apps on the Amazon app store, but there are several apps that I really wanted that are not available there. Because of this, I would not reccommend this product.

Reviews.Author: rachelle martin
Reviews.Content: love it!  I enjoy this more and more everyday. The pictures are great, the movie capabilities make it possible to stream right into our tv away from home and see our favorite shows.
Reviews.Title: Great price, great product!

Reviews.Author: Nilene B. Spencer
Reviews.Content: Enjoying it!!! I upgraded from the Kindle Fire and am glad that I did. It is nice to be connected everywhere I go.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 4G LTE

Reviews.Content: i dont use it kindle as much. since i bought it, ive only used it a couple of times. i cant do much with it other than watch netflix on it all day. i bought it for that purpose. i tried using pandora radio so many times but it would keep crashing every time so i give up on that. i have yet to try spotify but im going to later. it freezes a lot when i try and use certain apps. i have ipad mini and i use that more bc of facetime and pandora. kindle is still a very good product nevertheless and has a very nice quality specially for watching movies on netlfix. it doesnt lag or buffer its very handy to have.
Reviews.Title: its good, i guess?

Reviews.Author: Gabe Little
Reviews.Content: Small, fast, good content, excellent screen. The only problem I have with the Fire HDX (and all Kindle Fire units for that matter) is that they don't have a good video player / organizer for movies I put on the device myself. Meaning items that were not downloaded / purchased from Amazon.com. All of our kid movies are tagged with album art for easy identification by our toddlers. The apps included do not recognize album art so all of the movies show up as black boxes or a still of the first frame which is usually the Universal logo or something similar. I had to download and pay for an app to get this functionality. It should be available out of the box. Fix that and you get 5 stars!

Reviews.Content: When I decided to upgrade my tablet (Blackberry PlayBook) I really took a serious look at a few options. Since it is primarily for reading I decided that the Fire HDX 7" would be the one for me. Wow was I right. This thing is great. Nice clean display. Great Resolution. Surprisingly great sound. I'm very pleased with my purchase and I'm happy I stuck with the Kindle over my other choices.

Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire HDX7 is GREAT!  GIANT things really do come in small packages.  It doesn't have to be large in size to be GIANT in performance.
Reviews.Title: Small, but GIANT!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It had all the features.  Its hardware was impressive.  Its pedigree has been untouchable.  But alas, its downfall can be attributed to one very simple and headache causing problem.  The Blue/Purple ring around the screen.  I have had all the generations of Fires and I still have the original that the kids use to this day.  I upgraded to the first generation Kindle Fire HD7 and loved it.  All of the Fires have some flaws, that is to be expected.  BUT and heres the BIG BUT.  The fire, first and foremost is supposed to be for reading.  If it does not do this one simple thing well then why have it?  The blue ring literally hurt my eyes, to the point that I had to set on on dark mode to read.  Why have a Reader that hurts to read?  Every one that I have ever seen reviewed had this same issue. I figured that "they" were all being picky.  No sir, it was horrible.  I couldnt watch movies either because on any screen that was white, there was that blue tint.  In the end I returned it and am now using the first gen HD7.  I am thankful for Amazons return policy and the great customer service, but am appalled that they thought this was a good product.  To clear things up its only on the HDX 7 models and all others use the white LEDs.
Reviews.Title: Blue haze was the death of this Kindle Fire HDX

Reviews.Content: A perfect birthday present from my husband as it keeps giving me great fun & entertainment almost daily. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: NLA
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a cheaper option to our iPad as this is primarily used by my 8 year old. Let me just tell you, I prefer it as well. It is lighter than my iPad mini (which I love as I primarily use mine for reading). Also, it has GREAT parental controls. Your child can't get out of the parental control mode w/o the password. The parental controls have different time restriction settings for reading, apps and videos. Any parent approved app or book or videos can be added to your child's simulated device and those are the only items they can access.I LOVE the parental controls aspect of this device. The iPad doesn't have anything near this. I can trust that my little guy is only accessing things that I am okay with, without the need to hover constantly.Don't let my raving about the parental controls detract from the fact that I think this is a great device for adults as well. I am a huge amazon shopper and have the Prime membership and along with this app I can access a bunch of books, movies, tv shows for free via the Kindle or my iPad.

Reviews.Content: Took a while to decide to upgrade to this Kindle Fire HDX from my HD. I loved my original and love this one more. The home screen is great, like not having to scroll to find what I am looking for in my apps or books. Gave my old Kindle Fire to someone and they are now a Kindle fan.
Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle Fire HDX

Reviews.Author: Sandra G. Cook
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Kindle as a Christmas gift for my spouse.  I usually do very thorough research before ordering online but I messed up on this one.  With all the hype about the HDX, I assumed it would include GPS.  My lowly ASUS has it so why wouldn't the much hyped HDX?  Otherwise, it has some nice features but I just have a hard time getting past this major shortcoming.  The video is very good, audio is better than on the ASUS but I prefer headphones to the built in speakers on any tablet.  Processing speed is pretty good but perhaps the most impressive feature is the "Mayday" live help.  I've only needed it a couple of times but when you need it, it's there and I was very impressed with the quick response time and the knowledge of the operator.Not a big deal to me but another standard feature on my ASUS Transformer that's missing here is an HDMI connection.  It does have Bluetooth. Wireless is a little stronger than the ASUS. This tablet also lacks a memory card slot and a rear facing camera, both of which are included on the ASUS Transformer.Other than the lack of GPS, the most irksome thing is that you're pretty much locked into Amazon for content.  Many things I would get for free on Google are not free or not available on Amazon. Oh, and did I mention, unless you get the more expensive 4G version, THIS UNIT DOES NOT HAVE GPS?!  GRRRR!  The ASUS GPS works without a wireless connection as long as you load your maps and select your route while connected to a network and keep the tablet powered up.  Even if you have the 4G version of the HDX, I would not assume that GPS will work without a 4G connection.  Otherwise, why would GPS only be available with 4G?Revision 3/27/14: The Bluetooth is picky about what it will pair with. Can't connect with my Samsung mobile headset. It is also extremely picky about wired headphone jacks. Some work sporadically but many don't work at all. Some only get mono even though they give me stereo with other devices (like my computer or my ASUS tablet). So far the only headset I've found that works reliably and really well is a (fairly pricey) Sony Walkman in-ear headset with headband.  I've also had my first poor experience with Mayday since I first posted my review. It took a very long time to finally be told that the tablet is not compatible with my Samsung Bluetooth headset. To sum up, I don't doubt this device is very good for reading books but that's not what I bought it for. It's pretty adequate for web browsing but lacks several features that are standard on many if not most Android tablets, many of which are less expensive. If I had it to do over I'd probably opt for the smaller (less expensive) companion to my ASUS Transformer.
Reviews.Title: No GPS?! Revised 3/27/2014
